translated: The opponent‚Äôs statement, ‚ÄúIt is perceived,‚Äù

original: 'di la tshad ma mthong ba mod //
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma mthong ba mod //
translated: Is not seen to be valid here.

original: gal te ngo shes pa las nge //
analyzed: gal te ngo shes pa las nge //
translated: If it is ascertained from recognition,

original: bar du yang ni sgrub byed na //
analyzed: bar du yang ni sgrub byed na //
translated: And it is established in the middle,

original: ngo shes rjes dpag yin 'gyur na //
analyzed: ngo shes rjes dpag yin 'gyur na //
translated: Recognition would be inference,

original: mngon sum sngon 'gro can ma yin //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon 'gro can ma yin //
translated: And it would not be preceded by direct perception.

original: long ba brgyud pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: long ba brgyud pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: It would be like a blind person following another blind person.

original: rjes dpag gang yin de yang ni //
analyzed: rjes dpag gang yin de yang ni //
translated: And that which is inference

original: de ltar gyur pa grub ma yin //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa grub ma yin //
translated: Is not established in that way.

original: sgrib pas chod pa mi dmigs pas na de nyid kyi tshe mngon sum gyis 'gyur pa med par dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pas chod pa mi dmigs pas na de nyid kyi tshe mngon sum gyis 'gyur pa med par dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not perceived because it is obstructed, it is not perceived at that time by direct perception, which is not obstructed.

original: phyis sgrib pa med par dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: phyis sgrib pa med par dmigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is perceived later, when it is unobstructed,

original: de nyid kyi  sod pa'am 'gyur ba med pa yin mod /
analyzed: de nyid kyi  sod pa'am 'gyur ba med pa yin mod /
translated: then it is certainly not the same or permanent.

original: bar na yod ba ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pas ngo shes pas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bar na yod ba ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pas ngo shes pas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Since what exists in the interval is hidden, it is understood by recognition.

original: de lta na yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur te /
translated: Even so, it becomes inference,

original: gang gi tshe da ltar 'gyur pa med pa de'i tshe snga na yod pa yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe da ltar 'gyur pa med pa de'i tshe snga na yod pa yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the characteristics of inference, since it exists previously when it exists now.

original: de la mngon sum med na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa de mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin /
analyzed: de la mngon sum med na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa de mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin /
translated: If there is no direct perception in that case, how can inference have direct perception as a prerequisite?

original: thams cad sngon dang phyis yod pa ni 'o shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad sngon dang phyis yod pa ni 'o shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of recognition is that everything exists previously and later.

original: rjes su dpag pa rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin na rjes su dpag pa de yang rjes su dpag pa nyid las yin pa'i phyir mtha' thug la med pa nyid pas na mun pa brgyud pa nyid do//
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin na rjes su dpag pa de yang rjes su dpag pa nyid las yin pa'i phyir mtha' thug la med pa nyid pas na mun pa brgyud pa nyid do//
translated: If inference is preceded by inference, then that inference is itself preceded by inference, and so on ad infinitum.

original: gzhan gyis mngon sum du rtogs pa des na mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mngon sum du rtogs pa des na mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is preceded by perception, then it is preceded by perception by another person.

original: de la yang mngon sum med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la yang mngon sum med pa nyid do //
translated: But in that case, there is no perception.

original: gzhan gyis mngon sum du rtogs so zhes gzhan gyis rtogs pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'on te des smra'o zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mngon sum du rtogs so zhes gzhan gyis rtogs pa ni ma yin no // 'on te des smra'o zhe na /
translated: It is not that one person perceives and another person understands.üîΩIf it is said that the other person understands it because the other person speaks,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: tshig tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro//üîΩbden par yang pha rol po rang nyid kyang gang zhig des rtogs pa nyid pas rtogs so zhes ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro// bden par yang pha rol po rang nyid kyang gang zhig des rtogs pa nyid pas rtogs so zhes ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Because words are not valid cognitions.üîΩEven if it is true that the other person understands, it is not possible to understand that the other person understands.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa dang 'dres pa med par rtogs pa ni 'di ni khyod kyis rtogs so zhes de ltar rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa dang 'dres pa med par rtogs pa ni 'di ni khyod kyis rtogs so zhes de ltar rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is said that the other person understands without mixing it with the understanding of another, then it is not possible to understand that the other person understands in that way.

original: des na phan tshun ltos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na phan tshun ltos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the error of mutual dependence would ensue.

original: 'on te de lta bu nyid kyis rnam par 'gyur ba mthong pa des kyang de nyid rtogs so zhes rjes su dpag pa las rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de lta bu nyid kyis rnam par 'gyur ba mthong pa des kyang de nyid rtogs so zhes rjes su dpag pa las rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that one infers the existence of the self from the fact that one observes the transformation of the body in accordance with the self,

original: 'on ni de lta bu nyid du 'grub kyi gcig nyid ni ma yin pas de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //üîΩrjes su dpag pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul @238a * //
analyzed: 'on ni de lta bu nyid du 'grub kyi gcig nyid ni ma yin pas de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no // rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul @238a * //
translated: then the self would be established as such, but not as one, and that is not reasonable.

original: can ma yin no //
analyzed: can ma yin no //
translated: Inference does not have a particular as its object.

original: du ba las ni me nyid yin no zhes mi 'grub po //üîΩgal te spu ldang ba la sogs pa'i tha nyad mtshungs pa yod pas gcig nyid yin pa bde ba dang bdag la sogs pa yang ci ste de ltar ma yin /
analyzed: du ba las ni me nyid yin no zhes mi 'grub po // gal te spu ldang ba la sogs pa'i tha nyad mtshungs pa yod pas gcig nyid yin pa bde ba dang bdag la sogs pa yang ci ste de ltar ma yin /
translated: One does not establish fire from smoke.üîΩIf the self were one because of the similarity of such things as the bristling of the body, then why is pleasure, pain, etc., not the same?

original: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa ni phan tshun ldog pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir gcig nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa ni phan tshun ldog pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir gcig nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that pleasure, pain, etc., are not the same because they are mutually exclusive,

original: de ltar yin na rang dang gzhan gyis ma dres bar rtogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar yin na rang dang gzhan gyis ma dres bar rtogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid du rigs so //
translated: If that were so, then because of the realization of the non-difference of self and other, it would be reasonable that they are different.

original: de rtogs par ni yul gcig pa nyid mi rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rtogs par ni yul gcig pa nyid mi rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: But if they are realized, then the object is not realized as non-different.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin las yul gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin las yul gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no object other than the nature of the thing.

original: des na yod kyang sgrib pa yod pas ma dmigs so zhes bya ba de ni ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na yod kyang sgrib pa yod pas ma dmigs so zhes bya ba de ni ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, even if it exists, it is not perceived because of the obstruction. This is not established.

original: gal te gzhan gyis rtogs pa de nyid ngas rtogs so zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis rtogs pa de nyid ngas rtogs so zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If it is said that the other‚Äôs realization is the existence of the realization, ‚ÄúI realize that,‚Äù

original: gnod par byed pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then there is no fault.

original: 'dir dpyod pa zhib mos gnod par byed pa sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dpyod pa zhib mos gnod par byed pa sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the fault is not established by subtle analysis.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩgnod byed skyes pa med par ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / gnod byed skyes pa med par ni //
translated: BecauseüîΩthe realization by delusion

original: rmongs pa yis ni rtogs byed gang //üîΩde ni tha snyad thams cad la //
analyzed: rmongs pa yis ni rtogs byed gang // de ni tha snyad thams cad la //
translated: of that which is not produced by a faultüîΩis doubted in all conventions

original: the tshom za phyir 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: the tshom za phyir 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: and therefore is destroyed.

original: zhi ba mor rnam par dpyad na ni 'ga' yang rnam par gzhag par mi 'os par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhi ba mor rnam par dpyad na ni 'ga' yang rnam par gzhag par mi 'os par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if one analyzes in a subtle way, then it is not suitable to posit anything at all.

original: de yang mi rung ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste 'di ltar /
translated: That also is not correct, because:

original: zhib mor dpyod pa bkag pas ni //
analyzed: zhib mor dpyod pa bkag pas ni //
translated: By refuting subtle analysis,

original: tshad ma bkag par 'gyur pa yin //üîΩzhib mor dpyod pa tshad ma las //
analyzed: tshad ma bkag par 'gyur pa yin // zhib mor dpyod pa tshad ma las //
translated: one would be refuting valid cognition.üîΩThe opponent does not assert that

original: gzhan pa pha rol 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan pa pha rol 'dod ma yin //
translated: subtle analysis is anything other than valid cognition.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la gnod pa'i zhib mor dpyod pa gzhug go zhes bya ba tshad ma la ltos par tha nyad du bya'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la gnod pa'i zhib mor dpyod pa gzhug go zhes bya ba tshad ma la ltos par tha nyad du bya'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should understand that the statement ‚ÄúOne should engage in subtle analysis that undermines worldly conventions‚Äù is a convention that depends on valid cognition.

original: de lta yin dang bstan bcos brtsams pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bstan bcos brtsams pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then the composition of treatises would be pointless.

original: tha snyad rtsing ba'i blo 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos byed ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad rtsing ba'i blo 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos byed ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not that treatises are composed in order to increase the coarse intellect of worldly conventions.

original: bstan bcos rmongs pa zlog par byed pa yin no zhes thams cad khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos rmongs pa zlog par byed pa yin no zhes thams cad khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted by all that treatises are composed in order to reverse the confusion of worldly conventions.

original: gal te dpyod na gnod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dpyod na gnod par 'gyur na /
translated: If one analyzes, one will be harmed.

original: bzlog par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bzlog par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to reverse that.

original: spyi bor thog ni 'bab 'gyur ba //
analyzed: spyi bor thog ni 'bab 'gyur ba //
translated: The head will be struck by lightning.

original: shing lo yis ni skyob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: shing lo yis ni skyob mi 'gyur //
translated: The leaves of a tree will not protect you.

original: mkhas rnams la ni 'khor ba yi //
analyzed: mkhas rnams la ni 'khor ba yi //
translated: For the wise, the conventional

original: tha snyad kyang ni mi 'chad pa'am //üîΩji ltar gang bzhin bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang ni mi 'chad pa'am // ji ltar gang bzhin bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: does not cease even in nirvƒÅ·πáa.üîΩHow could the conventional

original: tha snyad nyams par gal 'gyur //
analyzed: tha snyad nyams par gal 'gyur //
translated: be destroyed by the way things really are?

original: tha snyad pa rnams kyi long ba brgyud pa nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i @238b tha nyad du 'gyur ba ni nyams pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams kyi long ba brgyud pa nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i @238b tha nyad du 'gyur ba ni nyams pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The conventional is not destroyed by the way things really are.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du zhugs pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid nges par rtogs pas zlog par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du zhugs pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid nges par rtogs pas zlog par byed do //
translated: For that very reason, those who have entered the path to nirvƒÅ·πáa realize reality and thereby cease the conventional.

original: kun rdzob tsam las ma rtogs par //
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam las ma rtogs par //
translated: Without realizing the mere conventional,

original: 'khor ba gzhan ni rtogs pa med //
analyzed: 'khor ba gzhan ni rtogs pa med //
translated: one does not realize cyclic existence.

original: de lta yin na de nyid ni //
analyzed: de lta yin na de nyid ni //
translated: If that were not so,

original: mya ngan 'das pa yin zhes gnas //üîΩde nyid de nyid min zhes pa'i //üîΩdbye 'di don dam du yod min //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa yin zhes gnas // de nyid de nyid min zhes pa'i // dbye 'di don dam du yod min //
translated: nirvƒÅ·πáa would not be the way things really are.üîΩThis distinction betweenüîΩreality and nonreality does not exist ultimately.

original: de nyid dpyad med pa nyid //
analyzed: de nyid dpyad med pa nyid //
translated: Reality is not analyzed.

original: de nyid min zhes nges par byed //
analyzed: de nyid min zhes nges par byed //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not reality‚Äù is the ascertainment.

original: de kho na nyid rnam par dpyod pa ni mtha' dag gnyis med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid rnam par dpyod pa ni mtha' dag gnyis med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When reality is analyzed, it becomes nondual.

original: de ma rtags na ni spros pa'i rang bzhin de nyid de kho na nyid ma yin ba'i 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: de ma rtags na ni spros pa'i rang bzhin de nyid de kho na nyid ma yin ba'i 'khor ba yin no //
translated: If it is not ascertained, then that which is of the nature of conceptual elaboration is not reality, and so cyclic existence is.

original: des na ma nges par brtags pas 'khor ba tshad ma ni 'dod pa nyid kyis thog tu bab pa'i phyir ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ma nges par brtags pas 'khor ba tshad ma ni 'dod pa nyid kyis thog tu bab pa'i phyir ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since the ascertainment of cyclic existence is just what is desired, how could it be destroyed?

original: ji srid de kho na nyid ma mthong ba de srid du ni tha nyad ldog pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji srid de kho na nyid ma mthong ba de srid du ni tha nyad ldog pa nyid de /
translated: As long as reality is not seen, it is just the ascertainment of cyclic existence.

original: des na 'dod pa nyid thog tu bab ste mkho ba'i skye bo rnams kyi tha snyad ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dod pa nyid thog tu bab ste mkho ba'i skye bo rnams kyi tha snyad ni 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is just what is desired, for this is the convention of those who desire it.

original: de la bags kyis bka' ma rig pa'i phyir gang la 'jig rten phyin ci log tu gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid re zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la bags kyis bka' ma rig pa'i phyir gang la 'jig rten phyin ci log tu gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid re zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since the world is ignorant about that, impermanence, which is erroneous for the world, is to be established for the time being.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe mthong ba de'i tshe de sngon dang phyi ma'i dus rnam par gcad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba de lta bu nyid yin no zhes de rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe mthong ba de'i tshe de sngon dang phyi ma'i dus rnam par gcad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba de lta bu nyid yin no zhes de rtogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, when it is seen, it is understood that it is just as it is seen, because it is apprehended as being distinguished from the prior and subsequent times.

original: de lta ma yin na dngos po rnams gzhag pa med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dngos po rnams gzhag pa med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, things would be completely unestablished.

original: 'di dag brjod pa ni gal te bar gyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa na snga phyi'i rang bzhin gnas pa med pa /
analyzed: 'di dag brjod pa ni gal te bar gyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa na snga phyi'i rang bzhin gnas pa med pa /
translated: This is said: If the present intrinsic nature is apprehended, the prior and subsequent intrinsic natures do not remain.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur ba nye bar gnas pa'i mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba de lta na yang ma dmigs pa tsam las med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur ba nye bar gnas pa'i mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba de lta na yang ma dmigs pa tsam las med pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though they do not exist as the characteristic of the object, they are not non-existent merely because they are not apprehended by the present direct perception.

original: dus gzhan du de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de'i tshe ni dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan du de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de'i tshe ni dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: When they become the characteristic of the object at another time, they are then just objects.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gang zhig gang du dmigs pa yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang zhig gang du dmigs pa yi //
translated: That which is the characteristic of the object

original: mtshan nyid der ni nye bar dmigs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid der ni nye bar dmigs //
translated: is just the object.

original: bum pa gzhan du dmigs gyur pa //
analyzed: bum pa gzhan du dmigs gyur pa //
translated: A pot that becomes the object

original: de 'dra gzhan yod ma yin /
analyzed: de 'dra gzhan yod ma yin /
translated: does not exist as another.

original: de bzhin du ;
analyzed: de bzhin du ;
translated: Likewise,

original: gang gi dmigs bya'i rang bzhin yin //
analyzed: gang gi dmigs bya'i rang bzhin yin //
translated: if it is the nature of the object of observation,

original: de tshe de ni dmigs pa nyid //üîΩgzhan tshe de nyid de 'dra nyid //
analyzed: de tshe de ni dmigs pa nyid // gzhan tshe de nyid de 'dra nyid //
translated: at that time it is the object of observation.üîΩAt another time, it is not that very same thing,

original: min pas gzhan tshe'ang dmigs ma yin //
analyzed: min pas gzhan tshe'ang dmigs ma yin //
translated: and therefore it is not observed at another time.

original: de yang ma dpyad pa yin te //
analyzed: de yang ma dpyad pa yin te //
translated: That is also unanalyzed,

original: 'di ltar / de yi rang bzhin gcig nyid na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de yi rang bzhin gcig nyid na //
translated: because in that case, if its nature is one,

original: de dang de min ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dang de min ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could it be that and not that?

original: du ma nyid ni yin na phyis //üîΩde @239a * //
analyzed: du ma nyid ni yin na phyis // de @239a * //
translated: If it is many,üîΩthen it is not suitable to say

original: nyid dmigs zhes byar mi rung //
analyzed: nyid dmigs zhes byar mi rung //
translated: that it is observed as that.

original: gang gis de med na der gnas pa'i rang bzhin med pas des ma dmigs par 'gyur pa dus zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de med na der gnas pa'i rang bzhin med pas des ma dmigs par 'gyur pa dus zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it does not exist, it does not have the nature of abiding in that, and therefore it is not observed. Time, which is called another, does not exist.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i ngo bor dmigs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid dus su bsnyad par 'gyur pa yin no ;
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i ngo bor dmigs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid dus su bsnyad par 'gyur pa yin no ;
translated: The nature that is observed as the entity of earlier and later is called time.

original: /'di ltar bdag cag la dus 'di gnas par gyur to zhes grang bas nyin pa'i rang bzhin dus yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: /'di ltar bdag cag la dus 'di gnas par gyur to zhes grang bas nyin pa'i rang bzhin dus yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, it is cold, and therefore it is time that has the nature of day. It is not another.

original: gal te dngos po gcig nyid ni //
analyzed: gal te dngos po gcig nyid ni //
translated: If one thing is one,

original: dus kyang gcig nyid yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: dus kyang gcig nyid yin par 'gyur //
translated: Time would be one.

original: des na dus de med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: des na dus de med pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because time does not exist,

original: de ni dmigs par gyur pa min //
analyzed: de ni dmigs par gyur pa min //
translated: it is not perceived.

original: de gnas na dus med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnas na dus med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it abides, time is not established.

original: gzhan nyid yin na dus rtag pa yin pa'i phyir de yang sngon dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin la sogs par dmigs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na dus rtag pa yin pa'i phyir de yang sngon dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin la sogs par dmigs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: If it is different, because time is permanent, it would be perceived as having a prior nature, etc.

original: 'on te dus kyi cha skad cig dang thang cig la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dus kyi cha skad cig dang thang cig la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the part of time, such as a moment, a second, etc.,

original: de'i tshe dus skad cig ma nyid du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de'i tshe dus skad cig ma nyid du 'gyur ro /
translated: at that time, time would be momentary.

original: dus nyid ces bya ba'i spyi'i rtag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dus nyid ces bya ba'i spyi'i rtag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the permanence of the universal called time,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: it is not so.

original: dus ni rjes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus ni rjes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because time is the nature of the subsequent.

original: yang na de yang sngon dang phyi ma'i dngos po dmigs pa'i phyir dus thams cad la dmigs par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: yang na de yang sngon dang phyi ma'i dngos po dmigs pa'i phyir dus thams cad la dmigs par 'gyur ro /
translated: Moreover, because the prior and subsequent entities are perceived, it would be perceived in all times.

original: 'on te dus kyi cha rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa de yang de lta mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'on te dus kyi cha rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa de yang de lta mi rung ste /
translated: If it is not perceived because the parts of time are not perceived, that nonperception is not so.

original: 'di ltar / gzhan mthong ba ni med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzhan mthong ba ni med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no seeing of another,

original: snang ba mi mthong ji ltar 'gyur //üîΩmi thong ba dang gcig nyid du //
analyzed: snang ba mi mthong ji ltar 'gyur // mi thong ba dang gcig nyid du //
translated: how could the appearance not be seen?üîΩIf it is not seen, how could it be one?

original: gang gis ji ltar mthong bar nus //
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar mthong bar nus //
translated: By whom and how could it be seen?

original: 'dis ni lhan cig byed pa 'das pa'i don khyad par yin pa yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhan cig byed pa 'das pa'i don khyad par yin pa yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: This also clarifies that the object of the past is a special condition.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po'i skad cig gis gsal bar bya ba'i dus nyid yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po'i skad cig gis gsal bar bya ba'i dus nyid yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that the object is clarified by the momentariness of the prior and subsequent entities.

original: de'i phyir gal te sgra brtsal ma thag tu dmigs pa yin na sngar gnas pa dang / phyis gnas pa'i rang bzhin du yang dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te sgra brtsal ma thag tu dmigs pa yin na sngar gnas pa dang / phyis gnas pa'i rang bzhin du yang dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if sound is observed immediately after effort, it would be observed as having the nature of prior and subsequent abiding. This is certain.

original: des na sngon dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin de yang de nyid kyi tshe dmigs pas rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir skad cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sngon dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin de yang de nyid kyi tshe dmigs pas rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir skad cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since that prior and subsequent nature is also observed at that time, there is no other nature, and therefore it is momentary.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de yang sgrib pa 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de yang sgrib pa 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: The definition of a pot, etc. is not tenable as a concealer,

original: bdag nyid thams cad dmigs pas na cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad dmigs pas na cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not observed in any way, since it does not do anything.

original: 'on te rtsol pa'i dbang po la phan @239b 'dogs na de'i tshe yang bdag nyid thams cad dmigs pas na sngon kyi rang bzhin dmigs pa'i phyir dbang po la phan btags pa ni rang bzhin nges par dmigs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rtsol pa'i dbang po la phan @239b 'dogs na de'i tshe yang bdag nyid thams cad dmigs pas na sngon kyi rang bzhin dmigs pa'i phyir dbang po la phan btags pa ni rang bzhin nges par dmigs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it benefits the active sense faculty, then also, since it is observed in all its aspects, the benefit to the sense faculty is not observed as a definite nature, because the previous nature is observed.

original: des na nges par de ma thag pa'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'dir mi 'gyur ba zhig na de ma thag pa nyid mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: des na nges par de ma thag pa'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'dir mi 'gyur ba zhig na de ma thag pa nyid mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is observed as an immediate nature.

original: des na de ni de tsam du zad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na de ni de tsam du zad pa yin gyi /
translated: But that is just so much.

original: rtag par dbang po nye bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag par dbang po nye bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not always the case that the sense faculty is brought near.

original: 'di ltar / legs byas las kyang de lta bur //
analyzed: 'di ltar / legs byas las kyang de lta bur //
translated: Thus,

original: gyur ba de nyid nyer dmigs phyir //
analyzed: gyur ba de nyid nyer dmigs phyir //
translated: because that very thing is observed as brought near,

original: legs par byas kyang de la ni //
analyzed: legs par byas kyang de la ni //
translated: even though it is well done,üîΩit is not observed as a definite nature.

original: de rang de ni yod ma yin //üîΩnyer bar dmigs par mi nus pa'i //
analyzed: de rang de ni yod ma yin // nyer bar dmigs par mi nus pa'i //
translated: That is not so, because it does not exist.üîΩIf it is not perceived,

original: rtag pa nyid ni yod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid ni yod mi 'gyur //
translated: eternality is not possible.

original: dmigs pa nyid ni yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid ni yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because perception exists,

original: dmigs pa las gzhan yod pa min //
analyzed: dmigs pa las gzhan yod pa min //
translated: there is nothing that exists apart from perception.

original: rtag pa nyid yin na ni dmigs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin na ni dmigs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were eternal, it would not be possible to perceive it.

original: gal te ma dmigs su chug mod de lta yang rtag pa nyid med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te ma dmigs su chug mod de lta yang rtag pa nyid med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: Even if it is not perceived, how can it be that it is not eternal?

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ma dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ma dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Non-perception is the characteristic of non-existence.

original: gal te de'i rang bzhin ni dmigs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i rang bzhin ni dmigs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If its nature is not the characteristic of non-perception,

original: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa kho na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa kho na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then perception itself does not exist.

original: de med na ji ltar yod pa nyid yin /
analyzed: de med na ji ltar yod pa nyid yin /
translated: If it does not exist, how can it exist?

original: des na rtag pa nyid srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rtag pa nyid srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, eternality is not possible.

original: sgra la phan 'dogs pa'i phyogs la ni de nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra la phan 'dogs pa'i phyogs la ni de nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: In the case of sound, it is impermanent because it is helpful.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: ltos pa med pa 'ga' zhig tshe //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa 'ga' zhig tshe //
translated: sometimes, without depending on anything,

original: 'bras bu mi byed 'gal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi byed 'gal ba'i phyir //
translated: because it is contradictory that an effect not be produced.

original: shes pa 'di 'dra res 'ga' pa'i //
analyzed: shes pa 'di 'dra res 'ga' pa'i //
translated: The cognition of the occasional presence of such an effect

original: 'bras bur grub pas de'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bur grub pas de'i rtags yin no //
translated: is the evidence for the pervasion.

original: sgra'am gzhan yang rung ste de dus gzhan du khyab par byed pa yin na de'i tshe de kho na ltar dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra'am gzhan yang rung ste de dus gzhan du khyab par byed pa yin na de'i tshe de kho na ltar dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If sound or anything else is pervaded at another time, then it would be perceived just as it is.

original: res 'ga' ma dmigs pa'i 'bras bu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ma dmigs pa'i 'bras bu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The occasional non-perception would not be an effect.

original: de ni res 'ga' ba'i rang bzhin can ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni res 'ga' ba'i rang bzhin can ma yin la /
translated: It is not occasional by nature.

original: gzhan du yang dmigs pa yang de 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du yang dmigs pa yang de 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: And even if perceived elsewhere, it is not apprehended.

original: 'on te de ni 'khrul ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de ni 'khrul ba yin te /
translated: But that is mistaken,

original: tshu rol mthong bas khyab pa'i rang bzhin dmigs pa ni nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tshu rol mthong bas khyab pa'i rang bzhin dmigs pa ni nus pa ma yin la /
translated: because one who sees only the present cannot perceive a pervasion.

original: de mi nus na gzung bar bya ba gzhan du mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de mi nus na gzung bar bya ba gzhan du mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And if that is not possible, it cannot be apprehended elsewhere.

original: de ni 'khrul ba yin yang mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'khrul ba yin yang mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: But even if mistaken, it is valid knowledge because it is non-deceptive.

original: gal te 'khrul pa 'khrul pa med pa'i mthong bas gnod pa de'i tshe 'di 'khrul pa yin no zhes nges par @240a * //
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa 'khrul pa med pa'i mthong bas gnod pa de'i tshe 'di 'khrul pa yin no zhes nges par @240a * //
translated: If error is invalidated by the perception of non-error, then at that time it is not possible to ascertain that this is error.

original: nus pa ma yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa ma yin na ma zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not so,‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: [we reply:] it is so.

original: yul dang dus khyab pa'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pa'i ngo shes kyi rtogs pas zlog par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul dang dus khyab pa'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pa'i ngo shes kyi rtogs pas zlog par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the realization of recognition that establishes the nature that pervades the object and time invalidates it.

original: de ni de ltar rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar rung ba ma yin te /
translated: That is not suitable in that way.

original: ngo shes pa yi nus pa de //
analyzed: ngo shes pa yi nus pa de //
translated: The capacity of recognition

original: 'dir ni sngar nyid bzlog zin te //üîΩ'di ni mngon sum nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: 'dir ni sngar nyid bzlog zin te // 'di ni mngon sum nyid kyis ni //
translated: has already been refuted here.üîΩThis is taught to be

original: gnod pa yin zhes bstan zin te //
analyzed: gnod pa yin zhes bstan zin te //
translated: invalidated by direct perception.

original: do shes kyi 'jug pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //üîΩmngon sum ni khyab pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: do shes kyi 'jug pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no // mngon sum ni khyab pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Recognition is not a valid cognition of direct perception.

original: dbang po'i byed pa las yin pa'i phyir dang / mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa las yin pa'i phyir dang / mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Direct perception does not apprehend a nature that pervades because it arises from the activity of the sense faculties and because it is non-deceptive.

original: des ni ngo shes pa ni mngon sum nyid kyis gnod pa yin no zhes sngar nyid bstan zin to //
analyzed: des ni ngo shes pa ni mngon sum nyid kyis gnod pa yin no zhes sngar nyid bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, the recognition of the object is refuted by perception itself.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te khyab pa yin yang ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te khyab pa yin yang ni //
translated: If it is all-pervading,

original: dngos po khol bur 'dzin byed na //
analyzed: dngos po khol bur 'dzin byed na //
translated: and if it is apprehended in part,

original: dngos po thams cad gcig nyid de //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad gcig nyid de //
translated: then all things are one,

original: de yi cha shas 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi cha shas 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: and it would be apprehended in part.

original: gal te rang bzhin sna tshogs kyi yul dang dus dang 'brel pas ni dngos po khyab pa gcig nyid yin yang gzhan du 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bar srid na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin sna tshogs kyi yul dang dus dang 'brel pas ni dngos po khyab pa gcig nyid yin yang gzhan du 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bar srid na /
translated: If it is possible that the object, which is related to various natures, times, and places, is all-pervading and one, but is apprehended as different,

original: dngos po mtha' dag gcig nyid du 'gyur te //
analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag gcig nyid du 'gyur te //
translated: then all things would be one,

original: dngos po dngos po zhes thams cad la ngo shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dngos po zhes thams cad la ngo shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the recognition of all things as ‚Äúthing‚Äù exists.

original: gcig nyid yin na bum pa la sogs pa'i dbye bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na ;
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na bum pa la sogs pa'i dbye bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na ;
translated: If it is one, the distinction of pot, etc., would not exist.

original: 'o na ni sgra la yang chen po la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang dbyangs la sogs pa'i dbye bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ni sgra la yang chen po la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang dbyangs la sogs pa'i dbye bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
translated: But it is the same for sound, because the distinction of ‚Äúgreat,‚Äù etc., and the distinction of vowel, etc., would not exist.

original: dbyangs la sogs pa'i dbye ba yang sgra zhes bya ba'i don tha snyad du gcig pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: dbyangs la sogs pa'i dbye ba yang sgra zhes bya ba'i don tha snyad du gcig pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: And the divisions of sound, such as melody, are the same in the conventional sense as the meaning of the term ‚Äúsound.‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba yang dngos po dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad med dam ci /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba yang dngos po dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad med dam ci /
translated: But are the divisions of pot, etc., not the same in the conventional sense as the meaning of the term ‚Äúentity‚Äù?

original: gcig nyid dang du ma nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gcig nyid dang du ma nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if they are the same, they would be one and many.

original: 'o na ni gcig nyid bden pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni gcig nyid bden pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, it would follow that one is truly existent.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / ngo shes pa yi mthu yis ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ngo shes pa yi mthu yis ni //
translated: By the power of recognition,

original: gcig tu 'dzin pas gcig nyid do //üîΩdu ma nyid du 'gyur bas de //
analyzed: gcig tu 'dzin pas gcig nyid do // du ma nyid du 'gyur bas de //
translated: one is apprehended as one.üîΩBut if it were many,

original: tshad ma can min byas bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tshad ma can min byas bar 'gyur //
translated: it would not be established by valid cognition.

original: gang gi tshe ngo shes pa'i rtogs pa tshad ma las ma yin pa de nyid kyi tshe ngo shes pa las bsgrub par bya ba mi bden pa nyid yin pas tha dad pa nyid bden par lus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ngo shes pa'i rtogs pa tshad ma las ma yin pa de nyid kyi tshe ngo shes pa las bsgrub par bya ba mi bden pa nyid yin pas tha dad pa nyid bden par lus pa yin no //
translated: When the cognition of recognition is not valid cognition, then the object established by recognition is not true, and so the difference is left as true.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir tha dad rang bzhin 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad rang bzhin 'dzin pa yi //
translated: The valid cognition that apprehends different natures

original: tshad ma gang la'ang tha mi dad bden med //
analyzed: tshad ma gang la'ang tha mi dad bden med //
translated: does not apprehend nondifference as true.

original: tha dad dngos la tha mi dad 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad dngos la tha mi dad 'gyur ro //
translated: If difference is real, nondifference is established by the fact that the mind apprehends them as joined.

original: rnam rtog las @240b yin de tshad ma min //
analyzed: rnam rtog las @240b yin de tshad ma min //
translated: Conceptualization is not valid cognition.

original: tha dad pa nyid bden pa yin na de tha mi dad pa ni rtogs pa'i bzos sbyor ba nges par 'dzin pa dzam gyis sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid bden pa yin na de tha mi dad pa ni rtogs pa'i bzos sbyor ba nges par 'dzin pa dzam gyis sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: If difference were real, nondifference would be established by the fact that the mind apprehends them as joined, as when one says, ‚ÄúI am hungry.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa mi bden na tha mi dad pa de gang zhig yin /
analyzed: tha dad pa mi bden na tha mi dad pa de gang zhig yin /
translated: If difference is not real, what is nondifference?

original: tha mi dad pa dzam gyis ni tha snyad du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa dzam gyis ni tha snyad du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Nondifference is not established by the fact that the mind apprehends them as joined.

original: de gang la tha mi dad pa'i chos yod pa'i phyir chos can tha dad par 'gyur ba dngos po chos can mi bden na ni tha dad pa med pa de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de gang la tha mi dad pa'i chos yod pa'i phyir chos can tha dad par 'gyur ba dngos po chos can mi bden na ni tha dad pa med pa de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: If the real thing, the subject, does not exist, then the difference of the subject does not exist, and the nondifference of the subject does not exist.

original: ri bong gi rva mi bden par ni de'i rna ba bden pa yin mi srid do //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva mi bden par ni de'i rna ba bden pa yin mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible that the rabbit‚Äôs horn is not real, and its ear is real.

original: gal te tha dad pa yang chos can tha mi dad pa med na gang gi yin par rtogs she na /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa yang chos can tha mi dad pa med na gang gi yin par rtogs she na /
translated: If difference does not exist without a nondifferent subject, what is the subject of the difference?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar / gang phyir gzhan dang 'brel med pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang phyir gzhan dang 'brel med pa //
translated: Because it is not related to another,

original: de nyid phyir de gzhan du brjod //
analyzed: de nyid phyir de gzhan du brjod //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be different from that.

original: gzhan du gzhan dang 'dre na ni //
analyzed: gzhan du gzhan dang 'dre na ni //
translated: If it were mixed with something different,

original: tha dad pa nyid nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid nyams par 'gyur //
translated: the difference would be lost.

original: tha mi dad pa ni tha dad pa bsal na med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ni tha dad pa bsal na med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not different, it would not exist when the difference is eliminated,

original: de'i chos kyi rang bzhin yin ba'i phyir spyi'i chos bzhin no //üîΩde'i phyir / ltos pa med 'ga' zhig tshe //
analyzed: de'i chos kyi rang bzhin yin ba'i phyir spyi'i chos bzhin no // de'i phyir / ltos pa med 'ga' zhig tshe //
translated: because it would be the nature of that, like a universal.üîΩTherefore,

original: 'bras mi byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir //üîΩshes pa 'di 'dra res 'ga' ba'i //
analyzed: 'bras mi byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir // shes pa 'di 'dra res 'ga' ba'i //
translated: it is contradictory for something to be independent and not always produce its effect.

original: 'bras bur grub pas de rtags yin //
analyzed: 'bras bur grub pas de rtags yin //
translated: Since the effect is established as being the occasional cognition of that kind,üîΩthat is the reason.üîΩIf the nature of a thing were always different, without interruption, then at that time the effect, the cognition, would also be just like that.

original: gal te dngos po'i bdag nyid dus thams cad du gzhan du chad med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na de'i tshe 'bras bu shes pa yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur de ris 'ga' zhig 'bras bu mi byed pa rnam par chad pa'i rang bzhin gang yin paüîΩder mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i bdag nyid dus thams cad du gzhan du chad med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na de'i tshe 'bras bu shes pa yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur de ris 'ga' zhig 'bras bu mi byed pa rnam par chad pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is interrupted, the nature of not sometimes producing an effect, would not be that.

original: de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa na rang bzhin de nyid gzhan la ltos nas 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa na rang bzhin de nyid gzhan la ltos nas 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When it holds its own nature, it does not hold that nature in dependence on something else.

original: de yang ma bzung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang ma bzung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it is not apprehended.

original: rnam par bshad pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa 'di 'dra ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa 'di 'dra ba ni /
translated: This kind of knowledge, which has the nature of an explanation,

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can res 'ga' ba'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can res 'ga' ba'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: is the effect of something that has such a nature.

original: res 'ga' 'bras bu las mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'bras bu las mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes, impermanence is understood from an effect.

original: gal te rang bzhin dang 'bras bur grub par bya ba'i don du dpe gnyis kyis gtan tshigs gnyis bstan pa ni mi rigs te //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin dang 'bras bur grub par bya ba'i don du dpe gnyis kyis gtan tshigs gnyis bstan pa ni mi rigs te //
translated: If the two reasons are stated by means of two examples in order to establish the nature and the effect, it is not correct,

original: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this very statement ‚Äúbecause it arises immediately upon exertion‚Äù is able to state both the reason of effect and the reason of nature.

original: re zhig 'di rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni rgol ba kun kha mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: re zhig 'di rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni rgol ba kun kha mthun pa nyid do //
translated: First, regarding ‚Äúthis is the nature,‚Äù all opponents agree.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni shes brtags yin pa'i phyir @241a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni shes brtags yin pa'i phyir @241a * //
translated: The reason of effect is investigated.

original: ro zhes da ltar kho na bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: ro zhes da ltar kho na bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that the example itself also teaches both.

original: des na dpe gcig nyid kyis gnyi ga bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ni byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni don med pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na dpe gcig nyid kyis gnyi ga bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ni byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni don med pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because the single example itself teaches both, it is meaningless to teach ‚Äúbecause it is produced‚Äù as a reason.

original: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang /
translated: This is true, butüîΩthis very example

original: 'di nyid kyis ni rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ni rang bzhin nyid //
translated: teaches the nature of the reason

original: grub kyang tha dad byas pa ni //
analyzed: grub kyang tha dad byas pa ni //
translated: even though it is established.

original: 'bras dang lhan cig bstan pa na //
analyzed: 'bras dang lhan cig bstan pa na //
translated: When the result is taught together with the reason,

original: thams cad de 'drar shes mi 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad de 'drar shes mi 'gyur //
translated: all should be understood to be like that.

original: 'bras bu dang lhan cig bstan pa na de dang lhan cig spyod pa yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs mtha' dag ni 'di lta bu nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang lhan cig bstan pa na de dang lhan cig spyod pa yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs mtha' dag ni 'di lta bu nyid yin te /
translated: When the result is taught together with the reason, because it is concomitant with that, all reasons based on the nature of things are like this.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la 'jug pa nyid yin no zhes 'dogs par 'gyur ba de rnam par gcad pa'i gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rnam pa gzhan kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i phyir roüîΩzhes bya ba 'di logs su bstan to //üîΩgal te / de la rigs mthun pa yod dang // rnam gnyis med la med gang yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la 'jug pa nyid yin no zhes 'dogs par 'gyur ba de rnam par gcad pa'i gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rnam pa gzhan kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di logs su bstan to // gal te / de la rigs mthun pa yod dang // rnam gnyis med la med gang yin //
translated: This is taught separately in order to eliminate the notion that there is no other type of reason of nature that pervades the similar class.

original: de ni gtan tshigs de las bzlog /'gal ba gzhan ni ma nges nyid //
analyzed: de ni gtan tshigs de las bzlog /'gal ba gzhan ni ma nges nyid //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt this explained in the line ‚ÄòThat which is in things of a similar type and not in things of a different type‚Äô?

original: bshad pa ma yin nam ci'i phyir logs su brjod ce na /
analyzed: bshad pa ma yin nam ci'i phyir logs su brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it taught separately?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar bshad pa /üîΩrjes su dpag par bshad zin don //üîΩgtan tshigs brjod byas rtogs don du //
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad pa / rjes su dpag par bshad zin don // gtan tshigs brjod byas rtogs don du //
translated: The answer is as follows.üîΩThe meaning of inference has already been explained.

original: rab tu dbye ba tsam bshad de ;
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba tsam bshad de ;
translated: The different types of reasons are explained in order to understand what is to be expressed.

original: / mtshan nyid la ni tha dad med //
analyzed: / mtshan nyid la ni tha dad med //
translated: There is no difference in their definition.

original: tha dad par bshad pas ni de nyid gsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par bshad pas ni de nyid gsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The separate explanations clarify that.

original: de la rigs mthun pa yod dang // rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni dper na sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rigs mthun pa yod dang // rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni dper na sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is produced,‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause it arises immediately after exertion.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin te gnyi ga yang ma bstan na rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di nyid srid pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gnyi ga yang ma bstan na rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di nyid srid pa yin gyi /
translated: If it were not so, and if both were not taught, then this very definition of ‚Äúhaving two modes‚Äù would be possible.

original: rigs mthun pa dang po yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid mi srid pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa dang po yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid mi srid pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is not a definition, because there is no example, of ‚Äúhaving a similar type.‚Äù

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa yin na de tsam gyis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir dogs par mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa yin na de tsam gyis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir dogs par mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: If it is a reversal in the discordant side, then it is not proper to doubt, because just that much includes everything.

original: de ni bden te de lta na yang dper brjod pa'i smros pa 'di ni rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de ni bden te de lta na yang dper brjod pa'i smros pa 'di ni rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: That is true, but even so, this statement of an example is for the purpose of understanding just that definition of inference.

original: mtshan nyid ni rang gi don rjes su dpag par bstan pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni rang gi don rjes su dpag par bstan pa de nyid yin no //
translated: The definition is the same as the one taught for inferring one‚Äôs own purpose.

original: 'o na ni gtan tshigs @241b dang de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa'o zhes gsum ston par mi byed /
analyzed: 'o na ni gtan tshigs @241b dang de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa'o zhes gsum ston par mi byed /
translated: But then it does not teach three: the reason, the reason that is similar to that, and the pervasion of the similar class.

original: de lta na rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it understood?

original: 'di ni rtsod pa ma yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni rtsod pa ma yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: This is not a dispute, because

original: des 'di 'bras bu'i rtags kyis ni //
analyzed: des 'di 'bras bu'i rtags kyis ni //
translated: it is said that this is a reason from effect.

original: rang bzhin phyogs gcig rten pa'ang bshad //
analyzed: rang bzhin phyogs gcig rten pa'ang bshad //
translated: It is also said to be a reason from nature that is restricted to one part.

original: des na rtsol las gsal ba dang // skye bar lhan cig brjod pa yin //
analyzed: des na rtsol las gsal ba dang // skye bar lhan cig brjod pa yin //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be co-present with the manifestation of effort and arising.

original: gang gi phyir rab tu dbye ba bstan pa rtogs pa'i don du yin pa des na slob dpon 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'di nyid kyis phyogs gcig rten pa'i rang bzhin yang bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab tu dbye ba bstan pa rtogs pa'i don du yin pa des na slob dpon 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'di nyid kyis phyogs gcig rten pa'i rang bzhin yang bstan to //
translated: Since the teaching of the divisions is for the purpose of understanding, the master also teaches a reason from effect that is a reason from nature that is restricted to one part.

original: de nyid kyis phyir 'dra bar dper brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis phyir 'dra bar dper brjod do //
translated: For that very reason, it is an example of similarity.

original: de lta yin na 'di na du ba yod pa'i phyir me yod do zhes bya ba shin tu gsal ba'i 'bras bu rtags nyid ci ste dper mi brjod de /
analyzed: de lta yin na 'di na du ba yod pa'i phyir me yod do zhes bya ba shin tu gsal ba'i 'bras bu rtags nyid ci ste dper mi brjod de /
translated: If that is so, then why is the very clear effect, ‚ÄúBecause there is smoke here, there is fire,‚Äù not cited as an example of an effect reason?

original: 'bad pas sgrub dgos pa'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid dper brjod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'bad pas sgrub dgos pa'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid dper brjod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of citing as an example an effect reason that must be established with effort and that occurs immediately after the effort?

original: des na brtsal las gsal ba dang / skye ba'i 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la dper brjod pa 'di 'dra bar gsungs so //
analyzed: des na brtsal las gsal ba dang / skye ba'i 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la dper brjod pa 'di 'dra bar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the example of an effect reason is stated as follows: ‚ÄúThe effect is clear from the effort and is produced from the cause.‚Äù

original: shes pa yang brtsal ma thag tu byung ba yin la rang bzhin yang yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par dper brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa yang brtsal ma thag tu byung ba yin la rang bzhin yang yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par dper brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since consciousness also occurs immediately after the effort and is a nature, it would be cited as an example.

original: gal te brtsal ba'i de ma thag pa ni rang bzhin yin la rang bzhin gyi de ma thag tu shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te brtsal ba'i de ma thag pa ni rang bzhin yin la rang bzhin gyi de ma thag tu shes pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the immediate antecedent of the effort is the nature and the immediate antecedent of the nature is consciousness,

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because that which is not a cause is not an object,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pas bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pas bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained by the assertions of others.

original: gzhan sgra rtag par smra ba ni sgra nyid brtsal ma thag tu byung ba yin par 'dod pas de la 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan sgra rtag par smra ba ni sgra nyid brtsal ma thag tu byung ba yin par 'dod pas de la 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: The assertion of the permanence of sound is the claim that sound itself arises immediately after effort.

original: yul yang rgyu yin pa nyid de rgyu ma yin na ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul yang rgyu yin pa nyid de rgyu ma yin na ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object is the cause itself, because if it is not the cause, it is not the object.

original: des na khyod kyis rtsol ba'i de ma thag pa'i 'dod pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni sgras kyang rang gi rnam par gtod pa'i sgo nas bskyed par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na khyod kyis rtsol ba'i de ma thag pa'i 'dod pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni sgras kyang rang gi rnam par gtod pa'i sgo nas bskyed par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever desire-cognition arises immediately after effort is itself generated by sound, by its directing itself to sound.

original: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma gzhan gyi dngos po mtha' dag gzung par thal te de gzhan du gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma gzhan gyi dngos po mtha' dag gzung par thal te de gzhan du gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it follows that the entire prior and subsequent other entity is grasped, because it is not possible to grasp it as other.

original: thor ling du ni gzung bar mi nus so zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: thor ling du ni gzung bar mi nus so zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has been demonstrated that it is not possible to grasp it as a whole.

original: 'on te yang byung ba dang 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi dus kyi cha'i tshogs mtha' dag la khyab pa gzung ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te yang byung ba dang 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi dus kyi cha'i tshogs mtha' dag la khyab pa gzung ba nyid de /
translated: But if the entire collection of temporal parts that pervade the arising and the nature of the arising is grasped,üîΩthen the entire collection of temporal parts that pervade the arising and the nature of the arising is grasped.

original: de lta ma yin na phyis mthong ba na sa la de'i tshe mthong ba de ni @242a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na phyis mthong ba na sa la de'i tshe mthong ba de ni @242a * //
translated: If that were not so, then when one sees it later, one would not see the earth at that time.üîΩ

original: 'di yin no zhes dran par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di yin no zhes dran par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, when one sees it later, how could one remember it, thinking, ‚ÄúThat which I saw at that time is this‚Äù?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / 'di ni de tshe'ang mthong ngo zhes //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di ni de tshe'ang mthong ngo zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúI saw it at that time‚Äù

original: ma bzung ba la 'jug ma yin //üîΩbzung ba nyid na dran pas na //
analyzed: ma bzung ba la 'jug ma yin // bzung ba nyid na dran pas na //
translated: is not applied to what is not apprehended.üîΩWhen it is apprehended, it is established

original: sngar gnas pa nyid sgrub par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngar gnas pa nyid sgrub par 'gyur //
translated: by memory as previously existing.

original: rtsod pa de yang ngan pa nyid de /
analyzed: rtsod pa de yang ngan pa nyid de /
translated: That objection is itself faulty.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / nga yis 'byung 'gyur bzung ngo zhes //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nga yis 'byung 'gyur bzung ngo zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúI apprehended the element‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa yis ni ma shes par //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yis ni ma shes par //
translated: is not known by the apprehension.

original: dran pa yis ni rnam shes pa //
analyzed: dran pa yis ni rnam shes pa //
translated: The consciousness by memory

original: de ni mchog tu ya mtshan no //
analyzed: de ni mchog tu ya mtshan no //
translated: is most amazing.

original: gang la 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin can 'dzin par byed pa med pa de la de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i dran pa byed pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po'i de kho na rnam par byed pa la cher mkhas so //
analyzed: gang la 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin can 'dzin par byed pa med pa de la de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i dran pa byed pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po'i de kho na rnam par byed pa la cher mkhas so //
translated: One who is skilled in the analysis of the reality of things would say that memory exists for one who has the nature of apprehending, but not for one who does not apprehend.

original: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin ni gzung bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin ni gzung bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of the element cannot be apprehended.

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i phyir te /
translated: because of doubt.

original: res 'ga' med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sometimes it does not exist.

original: ci ste gal te yod par 'gyur na ngas gzung ba nyid do snyam du phyir dran pas bzung zin pa nyid do zhes yul du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir de yang gzung ba kho na'o zhes bya bar 'dod na /üîΩ// / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: ci ste gal te yod par 'gyur na ngas gzung ba nyid do snyam du phyir dran pas bzung zin pa nyid do zhes yul du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir de yang gzung ba kho na'o zhes bya bar 'dod na / // / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: But if you think that if it existed, it would be remembered, because it would be remembered by the memory, ‚ÄúI have seen it,‚Äù and it would be made into an object, then it is also just seen.

original: mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi rung ste /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: gzung ba la yang gal te de //
analyzed: gzung ba la yang gal te de //
translated: If it is the object,

original: don ni ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: don ni ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: how does it engage the object?üîΩDoubt and apprehension

original: the tshom dang ni gzung ba dag / phan tshun du ni 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: the tshom dang ni gzung ba dag / phan tshun du ni 'gal ba yin //
translated: are mutually contradictory.

original: gal te de'i tshe yang yod par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe gzung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i byed pa che'o //
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe yang yod par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe gzung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i byed pa che'o //
translated: If it existed at that time, then it would be made into an object, ‚ÄúIt is seen.‚Äù

original: shes pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If consciousness does not exist,

original: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin nam /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin nam /
translated: is it the nature of apprehension?

original: de lta ma yin pa yin pa las rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa yin pa las rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or is it not? It cannot be other than these two.

original: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te mngon sum nyid la yang //
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro // gal te mngon sum nyid la yang //
translated: Because they are mutually exclusive by their very nature.üîΩIf there is doubt even in regard to perception,

original: the tshom ji ltar mngon sum nyid //
analyzed: the tshom ji ltar mngon sum nyid //
translated: how can there be perception?

original: ma dmigs pa la the tshom phyir //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa la the tshom phyir //
translated: Because there is doubt in regard to non-apprehension,

original: gzung ba the tshom yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzung ba the tshom yod ma yin //
translated: there is no apprehension of doubt.

original: gal te da ltar bzhin du bzung ba yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te da ltar bzhin du bzung ba yin na ni //
translated: If there is apprehension just as it is,

original: the tshom za ba ma yin te //
analyzed: the tshom za ba ma yin te //
translated: there is no doubt.

original: de dang tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from that.

original: de'i tshe gzung ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /üîΩda ltar ba'i rang bzhin las /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzung ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te / da ltar ba'i rang bzhin las /
translated: At that time, the apprehended object does not arise,üîΩbecause it is not different from the nature of the present.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir da ltar ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir da ltar ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is like the present itself.

original: 'o na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is arising because it is connected with the time of arising,

original: de lta na 'o na rang gi dngos pos na dngos po rnams da ltar ba la sogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na rang gi dngos pos na dngos po rnams da ltar ba la sogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: then in that case, things are not present, etc. by their own nature.

original: 'on kyang 'byung @242b ba dang da ltar ba dang byung bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'byung @242b ba dang da ltar ba dang byung bar gyur pa ni /
translated: But the past, present, and future

original: lhan cig gcig 'byung ba'i don dag kho na ste /
analyzed: lhan cig gcig 'byung ba'i don dag kho na ste /
translated: are only the objects that occur together,

original: dus gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other time.

original: yod na yang de yang lhan cig spyod pa'i don nyid yin no //
analyzed: yod na yang de yang lhan cig spyod pa'i don nyid yin no //
translated: Even if there were another time, it would be the same as the objects that occur together.

original: de lta yin dang dngos pos dngos po'i rang bzhin bzung ba na de'i rang bzhin yang gzung ba'i phyir the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos pos dngos po'i rang bzhin bzung ba na de'i rang bzhin yang gzung ba'i phyir the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, when one thing grasps the nature of another thing, then the nature of that other thing would also be grasped, and so there would be no doubt.

original: mi rtag pa'i don lhan cig spyod pa nyid ni 'byung ba dang byung bar gyur pa nyid ni yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don lhan cig spyod pa nyid ni 'byung ba dang byung bar gyur pa nyid ni yin no zhe na /
translated: The objects that occur together are impermanent, and the objects that occur together are the past, present, and future.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ngas bzung ba ni 'di nyid do zhes dran par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ngas bzung ba ni 'di nyid do zhes dran par 'gyur /
translated: But since it is not possible to grasp that which is like that, one would remember, ‚ÄúI have grasped just this.‚Äù

original: lhan cig spyod pa ma bzung yang rang gi ngo bo ni gzung ba nyid do zhes bya ba yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa ma bzung yang rang gi ngo bo ni gzung ba nyid do zhes bya ba yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if the objects that occur together are not grasped, it is not correct to say that the nature of that is grasped.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyed nyid kyi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyed nyid kyi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: But you accept that its own nature is not arisen and does not arise.

original: des na de'i phyir da ltar ba ni shes pas bzung ba'i phyir da ltar ba nyid du bzung ba yin no //üîΩji ltar sngon por snang ba yi //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir da ltar ba ni shes pas bzung ba'i phyir da ltar ba nyid du bzung ba yin no // ji ltar sngon por snang ba yi //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that the present is apprehended because it is apprehended by consciousness.üîΩJust as the consciousness to which blue appears

original: shes pas sngon po nyid 'dzin bzhin //
analyzed: shes pas sngon po nyid 'dzin bzhin //
translated: apprehends blue itself,

original: da ltar nyid du snang ba yang //
analyzed: da ltar nyid du snang ba yang //
translated: the appearance as present

original: da ltar nyid du rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: da ltar nyid du rtogs pa yin //
translated: is understood as present.

original: ci ste ma bzung ba ci ltar dran zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste ma bzung ba ci ltar dran zhe na /
translated: But if it is not apprehended, how can it be remembered?

original: thal ba 'di gzung ba la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: thal ba 'di gzung ba la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that this consequence is similar for the apprehension?üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar / 'dzin bzhin pa na dran pa med //üîΩde ni gzung ba'i rjes thogs 'byung //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dzin bzhin pa na dran pa med // de ni gzung ba'i rjes thogs 'byung //
translated: while it is being apprehended, it is not remembered.üîΩIt arises after the object is apprehended.

original: 'das par bzung la de yi ni //üîΩrang bzhin med pas de dran min //
analyzed: 'das par bzung la de yi ni // rang bzhin med pas de dran min //
translated: It is remembered as past.

original: dran pa da ltar skye ba yis //
analyzed: dran pa da ltar skye ba yis //
translated: But since it does not exist, it is not remembered.üîΩHow does the present memory

original: snga ma nyid ni ji ltar shes //
analyzed: snga ma nyid ni ji ltar shes //
translated: know the past?

original: yod min dngos med rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: yod min dngos med rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of a nonexistent thing

original: ji ltar de yi ngo bo dran //
analyzed: ji ltar de yi ngo bo dran //
translated: is not remembered.

original: de min rang bzhin shes par yang //
analyzed: de min rang bzhin shes par yang //
translated: And it is not tenable that it is the nature of memory.

original: dran pa yin zhes bab col chos //
analyzed: dran pa yin zhes bab col chos //
translated: It is a mere convention that it is memory.

original: 'on te bdag zhes de tshe yod //
analyzed: 'on te bdag zhes de tshe yod //
translated: But if it exists at the time of the object,

original: des ni sngon nyid shes pa nyid //üîΩ'dzin pa dang ni dran pa la'ang //
analyzed: des ni sngon nyid shes pa nyid // 'dzin pa dang ni dran pa la'ang //
translated: then it would have to be memory of that.üîΩIt is not tenable that it is the nature of memory

original: de ni nus par 'thad pa nyid //üîΩdang por 'dzin dang dran pa ni //
analyzed: de ni nus par 'thad pa nyid // dang por 'dzin dang dran pa ni //
translated: and the nature of apprehension.

original: gal te bdag las tha dad na //
analyzed: gal te bdag las tha dad na //
translated: If it is different from the self,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis de la ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis de la ni //
translated: then it would not be the nature of the self.

original: 'dzin dang dran pa de yod min //
analyzed: 'dzin dang dran pa de yod min //
translated: It would not be memory and apprehension.

original: 'dzin dang dran pa gzhan yin na de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de 'dzin pa po dang dran pa po ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dzin dang dran pa gzhan yin na de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de 'dzin pa po dang dran pa po ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: If it is different from memory and apprehension, it would not be the nature of the self, and it would not be the one who remembers and the one who apprehends.

original: lus kyang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would follow that the body would be the self.

original: ma yin te mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so because it is impermanent,

original: nam mkha' la sogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that space and so on would be the self.

original: gal te de la de gnyis mi 'du ba'i phyir ro zhes 'dod na de yang med pa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: gal te de la de gnyis mi 'du ba'i phyir ro zhes 'dod na de yang med pa dang mtshungs te /
translated: If you assert that it is not so because memory and apprehension are not present in space and so on, that is the same as saying that it does not exist.üîΩIn this way:

original: 'di ltar / de yi rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de yi rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is related to that,

original: 'dzin dang dran dang ldan pa nyid //
analyzed: 'dzin dang dran dang ldan pa nyid //
translated: and the possession of memory and apprehension.

original: mkha' @243a * //üîΩsogs kyang ni yin gyur te //
analyzed: mkha' @243a * // sogs kyang ni yin gyur te //
translated: Space, etc.üîΩwould also be so.

original: brtsad pa de yang mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: brtsad pa de yang mtshungs pa yin //
translated: This is the same as the previous argument.üîΩIt is not tenable that this is without any difference in the earlier and later times.

original: sngon dang phyis kyi dus su 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig med par ni 'di mi 'thad do zhes dran pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir dran pa po rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon dang phyis kyi dus su 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig med par ni 'di mi 'thad do zhes dran pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir dran pa po rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not tenable that memory is different, the experiencer is understood.

original: de lta yin dang nam mkha' la sogs pa nyid de ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de lta yin dang nam mkha' la sogs pa nyid de ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: If that were so, space, etc. would also be so.

original: don gzhan rtogs pa'i 'bad pas ci bya /
analyzed: don gzhan rtogs pa'i 'bad pas ci bya /
translated: What is the use of the effort to understand something else?

original: 'brel pa yang 'di nyid brtsad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang 'di nyid brtsad par bya'o //
translated: The relation should also be investigated.

original: yang na dran pa la sogs pa yang rtag par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dran pa la sogs pa yang rtag par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, memory, etc. should also be accepted as permanent.

original: 'di nyid bdag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di nyid bdag yin no zhe na /
translated: If this is the self,

original: gang la zin pa the tshom za //
analyzed: gang la zin pa the tshom za //
translated: then it is doubted whether it is grasped.

original: de la dran pas kyang ci shes //
analyzed: de la dran pas kyang ci shes //
translated: What is known by memory at that time?

original: dran pa de tshe med pa'i phyir//
analyzed: dran pa de tshe med pa'i phyir//
translated: Since memory does not exist at that time,

original: snga ma nyid du ci ltar rtogs //
analyzed: snga ma nyid du ci ltar rtogs //
translated: how is it known in the past?

original: zhes bya ba de nyid byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de nyid byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the same as the previous argument.

original: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin nyid ni mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin nyid ni mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the prior and subsequent moments is not apprehended by perception,

original: dran pas kyang ma yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: dran pas kyang ma yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: and it is not by memory either. This is a mere quibble.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa yin na snga ma dang mtshams mi sbyor bar brtsal ma thag pa nyid 'dzin par srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa yin na snga ma dang mtshams mi sbyor bar brtsal ma thag pa nyid 'dzin par srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if sound were permanent, it would not be possible for it to be apprehended immediately upon the effort to hear it, without connection with a prior moment.

original: des na snga phyi ma bzung ba'i phyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: des na snga phyi ma bzung ba'i phyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: Therefore, because the prior and subsequent moments are not apprehended, the statement ‚ÄúSound is impermanent‚Äù is untenable.

original: ji skad du shes pa ni rang gi ngo bo'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba yin gyi rtsol ba'i de ma thag pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa de ni gzhan du yang spangs par nus pa yin te /
