analyzed: 'on kyang gang la tshad ma yod pa de la rtog pa dang ldan pa 'dod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: However, one who has valid cognition will desire it if he is rational.

original: tshad mas 'grub pa ni mi 'dod kyang bzlog par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas 'grub pa ni mi 'dod kyang bzlog par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Even if one does not desire to establish something by means of valid cognition, it will not be established.

original: tshad ma ni 'dod pa la ltos pa med par rang dbang nyid du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ni 'dod pa la ltos pa med par rang dbang nyid du rigs pa yin no //
translated: Valid cognition is reasonable as an independent [means of knowledge] without relying on desire.

original: de lta ma yin na tshad ma la rang dbang med par 'dod pas dngos po yod pa dang med pa 'dor le na  byed na dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshad ma la rang dbang med par 'dod pas dngos po yod pa dang med pa 'dor le na  byed na dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then since you assert that valid knowledge is independent, you would not be able to abandon the existence and nonexistence of things, and things and nonthings would not be established.

original: rgol ba'i 'dod pas ni yul du gyur pa'i bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: rgol ba'i 'dod pas ni yul du gyur pa'i bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed la /
translated: The proponent‚Äôs assertion establishes the object, and

original: phyir rgol ba'i 'dod pas ni 'dod pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma 'chol bar gnas pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i 'dod pas ni 'dod pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma 'chol bar gnas pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: the opponent‚Äôs assertion is asserted. Therefore things and nonthings would not be established without confusion.

original: 'o na blo la sogs pa de dag kyang bdag yod par 'gyur ba yin zhes rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na blo la sogs pa de dag kyang bdag yod par 'gyur ba yin zhes rtogs pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äú But if you think that those such as the mind exist, then the self would exist.‚Äù

original: des na blo la sogs pa yod na srog la sogs pa ldog pa ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: des na blo la sogs pa yod na srog la sogs pa ldog pa ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: Therefore it is illogical to say that if the mind and so on exist, then life and so on would not be reversed.‚Äù

original: mi rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not illogical.

original: gzhan nyid de la 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid de la 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages with that otherness.

original: gal te bdag blo la sogs pa'i 'jug par byed pa nyid du nges pa yin na ni log pas ldog par byed pa nyid du 'thad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag blo la sogs pa'i 'jug par byed pa nyid du nges pa yin na ni log pas ldog par byed pa nyid du 'thad pa yin na /
translated: If it is certain that the self is the instigator of the activities of the mind and so on, then it is tenable that it is the dissolver of them when they cease.üîΩBut that is not so.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: Thus,

original: 'di ltar / srog dang mig 'byed la sogs ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / srog dang mig 'byed la sogs ni //
translated: life, opening and closing the eyes, and so on

original: dran 'dod rtsol ba las skye yin //
analyzed: dran 'dod rtsol ba las skye yin //
translated: arise from memory, desire and effort.

original: de dag yul dbang blo las 'byung //üîΩde yang phan tshun rkyen las ni //
analyzed: de dag yul dbang blo las 'byung // de yang phan tshun rkyen las ni //
translated: They arise from objects, faculties and awareness.üîΩMoreover, they arise from the mutual conditions

original: ldog pa'i rang ge rigs las 'byung //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rang ge rigs las 'byung //
translated: of the specific types of cessation.

original: de tsam la ni bdag dngos 'di //üîΩrjes 'gro ldog pa la brten yin //
analyzed: de tsam la ni bdag dngos 'di // rjes 'gro ldog pa la brten yin //
translated: This much is based on the self‚ÄôsüîΩconcomitance and reversal.

original: gzhan du rtog na thug pa med //
analyzed: gzhan du rtog na thug pa med //
translated: If you imagine otherwise, there is an infinite regress.

original: dran pa dang 'dod pa dang rtsol ba dag ni mi 'dod pa 'am de las gzhan 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa yin zhing de las ni srog dang mig 'byed pa la sogs @249a * //üîΩpa 'jug go //
analyzed: dran pa dang 'dod pa dang rtsol ba dag ni mi 'dod pa 'am de las gzhan 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa yin zhing de las ni srog dang mig 'byed pa la sogs @249a * // pa 'jug go //
translated: Memory, desire and effort are the instigators of the mind and mental factors that do not wish to engage with an object or that engage with something other than that object. From them, life, opening and closing the eyes and so on arise.

original: dran pa la sogs pa gang las 'jug ce na /
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa gang las 'jug ce na /
translated: From what do memory and so on arise?

original: yul dang dbang po dang blo dag las so //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang blo dag las so //
translated: They arise from objects, faculties and awareness.

original: de dag kyang phan tshun rten la ltos nas rang gi rigs las 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang phan tshun rten la ltos nas rang gi rigs las 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, they arise from their own type in dependence on each other and their support.

original: yul gyi ni yul snga ma nyid la dbang po dang yul dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: yul gyi ni yul snga ma nyid la dbang po dang yul dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The object depends on the former object, and the sense faculty and object are similar.

original: bdag gi dngos po ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa 'di dag tsam nyid la 'brel pa yin pas nye bar mkho ba med par gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa 'di dag tsam nyid la 'brel pa yin pas nye bar mkho ba med par gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: The self is related to the mere assembly of causes and conditions, so what use is it to posit another unrelated to the self?

original: gal te bdag med na snga phyi mtshams 'byor pa'i rang bzhin gyi dran par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te bdag med na snga phyi mtshams 'byor pa'i rang bzhin gyi dran par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If there is no self, wouldn‚Äôt memory of the connection between past and future lives be impossible?

original: 'di ltar gang gis mthong ba de nyid dran par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis mthong ba de nyid dran par byed pa yin te /
translated: The one who sees is the one who remembers.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba ni gzhan gyis dran pa'i yul du bya bar mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba ni gzhan gyis dran pa'i yul du bya bar mi nus so zhe na /
translated: The object seen by one person cannot be remembered by another.

original: 'di yang bzlog pa tsam ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di yang bzlog pa tsam ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this just a reversal of the previous position?

original: 'di las kyang ci ltar 'grub /
analyzed: 'di las kyang ci ltar 'grub /
translated: How is this established?

original: dran pa gcig las mthong ba ni med de /
analyzed: dran pa gcig las mthong ba ni med de /
translated: There is no memory of seeing.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma gcig pa nyid mngon sum gyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir dang / dran pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma gcig pa nyid mngon sum gyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir dang / dran pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the sameness of the former and latter moments is not perceived, and memory is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te gzhan gyis dmigs pa dang / mi dran pa de lta na yang gzhan gyi khyad kyis dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis dmigs pa dang / mi dran pa de lta na yang gzhan gyi khyad kyis dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is not perceived by another, and even if it is not remembered, it is remembered by the specific nature of another.

original: gzhan zhes te gzhan no cog mtshungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan zhes te gzhan no cog mtshungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù means ‚Äúanother,‚Äù not a universal.

original: gang gis de nyid dran pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba gzhan ma yin pa de lta bu ni rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de nyid dran pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba gzhan ma yin pa de lta bu ni rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin te /
translated: That which is the cause of memory is not another, but is like that which arises from its own cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cause and effect are ascertained.

original: bdag yod pa nyid kyis ni dran pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag yod pa nyid kyis ni dran pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not memory because of the existence of the self.

original: 'o na gsal ba goms pa dang ldan pa'i rgyud yod pa las so //
analyzed: 'o na gsal ba goms pa dang ldan pa'i rgyud yod pa las so //
translated: Rather, it is from the existence of the continuum that possesses the cultivation of clarity.

original: de lta ma yin na ni rtag tu dran par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni rtag tu dran par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that there would always be memory.

original: gal te 'di skad du bdag yod na dran pa nyid do zhes mi brjod kyi gal te dran pa ni bdag yod pa nyid de dran pa po med pa dran pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du bdag yod na dran pa nyid do zhes mi brjod kyi gal te dran pa ni bdag yod pa nyid de dran pa po med pa dran pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúIf the self exists, it is just memory,‚Äù then memory is the existence of the self, because it is impossible to have memory without a menter.üîΩThat is also not correct.

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Because,üîΩIf it were, it would be, because it would be,

original: 'di ltar / de 'gyur na ni 'gyur phyir dang // rjes 'gro ldog pa'i rjes byed phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de 'gyur na ni 'gyur phyir dang // rjes 'gro ldog pa'i rjes byed phyir //
translated: And because it follows the conformity and reversal.

original: 'di rgyu 'bras bu dngos po ste //
analyzed: 'di rgyu 'bras bu dngos po ste //
translated: This is the cause and effect of a thing.

original: de ltar min na gzhan med 'gyur //üîΩdran pa dang ni sngon nyams su myong ba goms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / de 'gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar min na gzhan med 'gyur // dran pa dang ni sngon nyams su myong ba goms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / de 'gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag rgyu ma yin no //
translated: If it were not so, there would be no other.üîΩBecause memory follows the conformity and reversal of the experience of the past, and because it would be, if it were, the self is not the cause.

original: ci ste khyab pa dang rtag pa med par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste khyab pa dang rtag pa med par mi 'gyur na /
translated: But if it were not so, that is, if it were not the case that the self is the cause of memory, then the self would not exist without pervasiveness and permanence.

original: de ltar ma yin na dus la sogs pa yang rgyu yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na dus la sogs pa yang rgyu yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then time and so on would also become the cause,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference.

original: 'on te myong ba po dang ngan pa po med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te myong ba po dang ngan pa po med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is not so, then the experiencer and the agent would not exist.

original: de ni de @249b ltar ma yin te /üîΩdran pa myong ba dag las ni //
analyzed: de ni de @249b ltar ma yin te / dran pa myong ba dag las ni //
translated: This is not so.üîΩFrom memory and experience,

original: dran po myong po de rtogs na //üîΩnam mkha' de ltar yin par ni //
analyzed: dran po myong po de rtogs na // nam mkha' de ltar yin par ni //
translated: the experiencer and the agent are understood.

original: ci yi phyir na rtogs mi byed //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na rtogs mi byed //
translated: Why is it not understood thatüîΩspace is like that?

original: dran pa dang myong ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas dran pa po dang myong ba po 'ga' zhig rtogs pa yin gyi nam mkha' la sogs pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang myong ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas dran pa po dang myong ba po 'ga' zhig rtogs pa yin gyi nam mkha' la sogs pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Since memory and experience are not tenable as different, the experiencer and the agent are understood as something, but not as different from space and so on.

original: de lta yin dang gcig 'ga' zhig yod do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gcig 'ga' zhig yod do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would be understood that something exists.

original: de yang nam mkha' la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang nam mkha' la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not incompatible with space and so on,

original: khyab pa dang rtag pa dang lus can ma yin pa la sogs pas khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa dang rtag pa dang lus can ma yin pa la sogs pas khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not differentiated by being pervasive, permanent, incorporeal, and so on.

original: 'on te nga'o zhes byed pa po nyid du rtogs pa'i bdag yin gyi lus can ma yin pa tsam ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nga'o zhes byed pa po nyid du rtogs pa'i bdag yin gyi lus can ma yin pa tsam ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the self is the agent that is understood as ‚ÄúI,‚Äù not just something that is not corporeal,

original: nga'o snyam pa'i rtog pa la ni lhas byin nga ni gar gyi rigs so zhe 'am /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i rtog pa la ni lhas byin nga ni gar gyi rigs so zhe 'am /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is the thought ‚ÄúI am Lhejin of the Gadha clan.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: sngon po'o zhes lus nyid snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngon po'o zhes lus nyid snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: In the thought ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù does not the body itself appear as ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äù or ‚Äúblue‚Äù?

original: lus kyi mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the body is impermanent,üîΩno, because the body‚Äôs condition is impermanent, but the one who has the condition, like the world beyond, is not different.

original: ma yin te lus kyi gnas skabs mi rtag pa yin gyi gnas skabs can ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs par tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa 'di nyid blo'i tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te lus kyi gnas skabs mi rtag pa yin gyi gnas skabs can ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs par tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa 'di nyid blo'i tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the thought is different from the mind.

original: dran pa la sogs pa ni lus la gnas pa nyid du rtogs kyi lus can ma yin pa la gnas par ni ma yin no //üîΩ'on te re zhig rtogs pa po gcig 'grub pas de lus yin nam /
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa ni lus la gnas pa nyid du rtogs kyi lus can ma yin pa la gnas par ni ma yin no // 'on te re zhig rtogs pa po gcig 'grub pas de lus yin nam /
translated: It is understood that memory and so on reside in the body, but not that they reside in the non-body.üîΩIf you say that the body is the thinker,

original: gzhan yin pa'i rtogs pa gzhan gyis ci bya zhe na de yang ma rung ste /üîΩgang phyir gnas skabs tshogs las ni //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i rtogs pa gzhan gyis ci bya zhe na de yang ma rung ste / gang phyir gnas skabs tshogs las ni //
translated: what use is it to think that the body is one thing and the thinker another?üîΩThat is not right,

original: lus gzhan rtogs pa yod min pa //
analyzed: lus gzhan rtogs pa yod min pa //
translated: because the body is not cognized as another when the collection of conditions is different.

original: de nyid phyir na ded kyi phyogs //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na ded kyi phyogs //
translated: Therefore, the position of the opponent

original: grub pa la ni gnod med pa //
analyzed: grub pa la ni gnod med pa //
translated: is not undermined by what is established.

original: gzhan yang / rtag pa'i rang bzhin 'gyur med la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rtag pa'i rang bzhin 'gyur med la //
translated: Moreover:

original: dran myong dag las gal te de //
analyzed: dran myong dag las gal te de //
translated: If it is from the experience of memory

original: dran byed rtag tu ring na ni //
analyzed: dran byed rtag tu ring na ni //
translated: That the permanent is remembered,

original: de nyid ci ltar don rig 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid ci ltar don rig 'gyur //
translated: Then how could it be the experiencer of objects?

original: bde la sogs pas 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: bde la sogs pas 'gyur na ni //
translated: If it is from pleasure and so on,

original: rtag pa nyid du'ang 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du'ang 'thad ma yin //
translated: Then it is not tenable that it is permanent.

original: bde sogs kyis ni 'gyur med na //
analyzed: bde sogs kyis ni 'gyur med na //
translated: If it is not from pleasure and so on,

original: bde la sogs par gnas mi 'thad //
analyzed: bde la sogs par gnas mi 'thad //
translated: Then it is not tenable that it abides in pleasure and so on.

original: gang phyir dran pa 'bras yin pa //
analyzed: gang phyir dran pa 'bras yin pa //
translated: Since memory is the effect,

original: des na myong bas cis ma yin //
analyzed: des na myong bas cis ma yin //
translated: Why is it not the experiencer?

original: 'on te nga zhes rnam shes pa //
analyzed: 'on te nga zhes rnam shes pa //
translated: If the consciousness called ‚ÄúI‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam ma yin //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam ma yin //
translated: Is not merely the cause and effect,

original: 'di ltar sngon mthong bzung ba ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon mthong bzung ba ni //
translated: Then the apprehension of what was seen before

original: nga yi dran pas rnam nges par //
analyzed: nga yi dran pas rnam nges par //
translated: Is ascertained by the memory of ‚ÄúI.‚ÄùüîΩAll beings think,

original: rtogs zhes 'gro ba thams cad kyis //üîΩbyed pa nyid na rtogs pa nyid //
analyzed: rtogs zhes 'gro ba thams cad kyis // byed pa nyid na rtogs pa nyid //
translated: ‚ÄúI realize.‚ÄùüîΩThis is not so.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: Thus:

original: 'di ltar / sngon mthong dran zhes rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sngon mthong dran zhes rtogs pa ni //
translated: The realization of ‚ÄúI remember what was seen before‚Äù

original: bdag las skyes pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: bdag las skyes pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: Is not from mere arising from that.

original: tshad med de lta yod na ni //
analyzed: tshad med de lta yod na ni //
translated: If it were, it would be immeasurable.

original: kun 'gyur rnam gzhag med par @250a * //
analyzed: kun 'gyur rnam gzhag med par @250a * //
translated: There would be no theory of universal flux.

original: 'gyur // gal te rgyu bdag las skyes pa tsam gyis shes pa tshad ma yin na /üîΩthams cad tshad mar 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gyur // gal te rgyu bdag las skyes pa tsam gyis shes pa tshad ma yin na / thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: If consciousness were valid knowledge simply because it arises from its own cause,üîΩthen everything would be valid knowledge.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: And then everything would be established for everyone.

original: des na ches 'chol par gyur to //
analyzed: des na ches 'chol par gyur to //
translated: And that would be a great confusion.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig dbang po nyams pa med pa la brten nas 'byung ba de nyid tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig dbang po nyams pa med pa la brten nas 'byung ba de nyid tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which arises in dependence on unimpaired faculties is valid knowledge.

original: de lta yin dang gang gis 'di ni dran pa dang mtshams sbyor ba la yang nus pa yod pa yin no zhes brjod par bden par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gang gis 'di ni dran pa dang mtshams sbyor ba la yang nus pa yod pa yin no zhes brjod par bden par 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, then it would be true to say that memory and connection have power.

original: mig la sogs pas bskyed pa'i shes pas rjes su 'brel pa bcad pa med pa'i phyir snga phyi gcig tu rtogs pa bden pa ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mig la sogs pas bskyed pa'i shes pas rjes su 'brel pa bcad pa med pa'i phyir snga phyi gcig tu rtogs pa bden pa ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be true that one understands the prior and subsequent as one, because the consciousness produced by the eye and so on is not interrupted by connection?

original: dran par 'gyur ba'i rtogs pa med par ni bdag gis bdag gam gzhan rjes su 'brel pas rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dran par 'gyur ba'i rtogs pa med par ni bdag gis bdag gam gzhan rjes su 'brel pas rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Without the understanding that is remembered, one does not understand by connecting oneself or another.

original: des na ngas dran no zhes bya ba 'di ni kun rdzob tsam kho na'o //
analyzed: des na ngas dran no zhes bya ba 'di ni kun rdzob tsam kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, this statement ‚ÄúI remember‚Äù is mere conventional expression.

original: des na kun rdzob pa'i bdag gis ni thams cad 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na kun rdzob pa'i bdag gis ni thams cad 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, everything is tenable by means of the conventional self.üîΩMoreover:üîΩThe object of hearing and life force, etc.

original: gzhan yang / 'khrul pa nyid kyis mnyan bya dang // srog sogs 'di ni mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'khrul pa nyid kyis mnyan bya dang // srog sogs 'di ni mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: are similar in this regard,üîΩbecause they are not reversed,

original: ma yin ldog pa can yin yang //
analyzed: ma yin ldog pa can yin yang //
translated: even though they are erroneous.

original: 'di la 'khrul med phyir zhe na //üîΩci ltar sgrub mi na nyid las de //
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul med phyir zhe na // ci ltar sgrub mi na nyid las de //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause there is no error in this case,‚Äù

original: ldog min 'o na don gyis de //
analyzed: ldog min 'o na don gyis de //
translated: then the object of hearing is not reversedüîΩdue to the nonerroneous nature of the object of hearing.

original: bsgrub bya'i rjes 'jug min de ltar //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i rjes 'jug min de ltar //
translated: But then the object of hearing is not a subsequent state of the object of attainment.üîΩThus, it is said that the object of hearing is not a subsequent state of the object of attainment.

original: brjod 'gyur de ni gzhan las mtshungs //
analyzed: brjod 'gyur de ni gzhan las mtshungs //
translated: This is the same for the other.

original: mnyan bya nyid dang srog la sogs pa ni khyad par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid dang srog la sogs pa ni khyad par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of hearing and life force, etc. are not different,

original: ldog pa 'ba' zhig par gnyi ga yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa 'ba' zhig par gnyi ga yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are similar in being mere reversals.

original: des na gcig ni 'khrul pa yin la rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: des na gcig ni 'khrul pa yin la rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: Therefore, what is the point of this method of saying, ‚ÄúOne is erroneous, but the nature is not‚Äù?

original: gal te ldog pa mtshungs pa ma yin te yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te ldog pa mtshungs pa ma yin te yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that the two are not similar because their objects are different,üîΩthen sound is also not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.

original: mnyan bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis ka las kyang ldog pa yin la /üîΩsrog la sogs pa ni ma yin te /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa kho na las ldog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis ka las kyang ldog pa yin la / srog la sogs pa ni ma yin te / bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa kho na las ldog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Sound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.

original: 'o na mnyan bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang ldog go zhes bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'jug pa med par bstan pa yin na /üîΩde ni srog la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa nyid do //üîΩde yang mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na mnyan bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang ldog go zhes bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'jug pa med par bstan pa yin na / de ni srog la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa nyid do // de yang mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Sound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa dang med pa nye bar dgod pa ni dgos /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa dang med pa nye bar dgod pa ni dgos /
translated: Sound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.

original: 'di ltar / bsgrub min nyid las rnam chad ces //üîΩbsgrub bya gnas par @250b brjod pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bsgrub min nyid las rnam chad ces // bsgrub bya gnas par @250b brjod pa yin //
translated: Sound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.

original: de nyid phyir na don go bas //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na don go bas //
translated: Sound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different.üîΩSound is not similar to the object of hearing because the two are different

original: gcig gis gnyis ka bstan par brjod //
analyzed: gcig gis gnyis ka bstan par brjod //
translated: One statement shows both.

original: nges par bzung ba nges pa nyid du gzung bas ni bzlog pa bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par bzung ba nges pa nyid du gzung bas ni bzlog pa bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: By the specification, there is the establishment of the opposite.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid las rnam par chad pa mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang rnam par chad pa yin na de'i tshe nges par gzung ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid las rnam par chad pa mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang rnam par chad pa yin na de'i tshe nges par gzung ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the probandum were distinguished from that which is not the probandum, and also distinguished from the similar instance, then at that time the specification would be pointless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khyed kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid las rnam par chad pa zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di las gcig gis kyang gnyis ka bstan par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khyed kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid las rnam par chad pa zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di las gcig gis kyang gnyis ka bstan par byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by this statement, ‚Äúdistinguished from that which is not the probandum,‚Äù one statement shows both.

original: de'i phyir rjes 'gro med pa las //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes 'gro med pa las //
translated: Therefore, without pervasion,

original: 'di 'dra'i mi 'khrul 'grub ma yin //
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i mi 'khrul 'grub ma yin //
translated: nonerroneously ascertaining this is not established.

original: nges par gzung ba'i mtshan nyid rjes su 'gro bas khyab pa'i mi 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ci ltar khyab par byed pa rjes su 'gro ba med par 'gyur /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba'i mtshan nyid rjes su 'gro bas khyab pa'i mi 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ci ltar khyab par byed pa rjes su 'gro ba med par 'gyur /
translated: How could there be nonerroneous pervasion by the characteristic of specification without the pervasion of the pervader?

original: yang na bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid la rnam par chad pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa med par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid la rnam par chad pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa med par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, in the case of the nonexistence of the probandum, this is called ‚Äúthe exclusion of the other.‚Äù This is not the apprehension of the nonapprehension of the positive.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag ni mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag ni mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The entire class of the dissimilar is not seen.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: It is through the positive that there is exclusion.

original: bdag nyid la ni 'brel pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag nyid la ni 'brel pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the connection with itself,

original: gzhan las ldog par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: there is the exclusion of the other.

original: de las gzhan las ldog min na //
analyzed: de las gzhan las ldog min na //
translated: If there is no exclusion from the other,

original: ci ltar de la 'brel par 'gyur //
analyzed: ci ltar de la 'brel par 'gyur //
translated: how can there be a connection with it?

original: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa nyid ma yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa nyid ma yin no zhe na ;
translated: But if it does not exist in the probandum,

original: 'o na med pa la med par 'gyur bas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa kho na las zhes ma 'khrul par ci ltar 'gyur /üîΩ'di ltar / bkag pa 'gog par byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'o na med pa la med par 'gyur bas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa kho na las zhes ma 'khrul par ci ltar 'gyur / 'di ltar / bkag pa 'gog par byed pa ni //
translated: then since it would not exist in the nonexistent, how could it be nonerroneously ascertained as ‚Äúonly in the non-probandum‚Äù?üîΩThus,üîΩWhat is the negation of the negation like?

original: bsgrub pa las gzhan ci 'dra zhig //
analyzed: bsgrub pa las gzhan ci 'dra zhig //
translated: It is different from the affirmation.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid la /
translated: In the case of the nonexistence of the probandum,

original: med do zhes nges par gzung ba gang yin pa des ni bsgrub bya la med pa bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: med do zhes nges par gzung ba gang yin pa des ni bsgrub bya la med pa bkag pa yin te /
translated: But when one definitely holds that it does not exist, then one is refuting the nonexistence of the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la med pa yin gyi /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba la ni med pa ma yin no zhes dgag pa 'gog pas sgrub pa nyid bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la med pa yin gyi / bsgrub par bya ba la ni med pa ma yin no zhes dgag pa 'gog pas sgrub pa nyid bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not nonexistent in the nonprobandum,üîΩbut it is not nonexistent in the probandum. Thus, by refuting the negation, one is proving the probandum.

original: ci ste / bsgrub bya med las ldog med pa //üîΩdes na sgrub min nyid las med //
analyzed: ci ste / bsgrub bya med las ldog med pa // des na sgrub min nyid las med //
translated: But if the probandum does not exist, then the negation does not exist.üîΩTherefore, it is not the probandum.

original: med ces ldog pa de nyid ni //
analyzed: med ces ldog pa de nyid ni //
translated: But if the negation does not exist,

original: ci ltar med las ldog par 'dod //
analyzed: ci ltar med las ldog par 'dod //
translated: how can one assert that it is the negation of the nonexistence of the probandum?

original: ci ste srog la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs la mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de las ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste srog la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs la mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de las ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: But if one says that the reason, such as the soul, is not the negation of the probandum because the similar instance does not exist,

original: med pa las ni ldog par nus pa ma yin te 'byung khungs nyid med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang las ldog par rtogs par 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' @251a * //
analyzed: med pa las ni ldog par nus pa ma yin te 'byung khungs nyid med pa'i phyir ro // gang las ldog par rtogs par 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' @251a * //
translated: then it is not possible that it is the negation of the nonexistence of the probandum, because the source itself does not exist.üîΩBut if one says that the so-called nonexistence of the probandum does not exist at all,

original: yang yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: from which one could understand the negation,

original: gal te med pa las mi ldog na ldog pa'i ldog par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te med pa las mi ldog na ldog pa'i ldog par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it does not turn back from non-existence, how could it be a turning back of a turning back?

original: de yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang med do zhe na /
translated: And that is not so, you say.

original: gal te ldog pa'i ldog pa 'gog na ldog pa'i ldog pa las ldog par ci ltar ldog ces thug pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: gal te ldog pa'i ldog pa 'gog na ldog pa'i ldog pa las ldog par ci ltar ldog ces thug pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med do //
translated: If you stop the turning back of a turning back, how could you turn back from the turning back of a turning back? There is no understanding because of infinite regress.

original: bkag pa dang ldog pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig nyid do //
analyzed: bkag pa dang ldog pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig nyid do //
translated: Stopping and turning back are the same thing.

original: ldog pa'i gzhir gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid ldog pa'i 'byung khungs yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i gzhir gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid ldog pa'i 'byung khungs yin no //
translated: That which is the basis of turning back is the source of turning back.

original: gal te gang dang ldan pa yod pa de bral ba'i 'byung khungs ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gang dang ldan pa yod pa de bral ba'i 'byung khungs ma yin nam /
translated: If that which exists as having something is not the source of separation,

original: dngos po med pa dang ni ldog pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang ni ldog pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: non-existence does not have a turning back.

original: gang dang ldan pa mi srid pa de chos shin tu 'byung gnas nyid ci ste ma yin //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pa mi srid pa de chos shin tu 'byung gnas nyid ci ste ma yin //
translated: How could that which is impossible to have be a source of a phenomenon?

original: bral ba tsam 'byung khungs yin gyi ldan par yang gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bral ba tsam 'byung khungs yin gyi ldan par yang gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Separation is the source, but it is not the case that it has something.

original: de ltar ma yin na ni ldog pa yod pa nyid las ldog pa yod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar yin /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ni ldog pa yod pa nyid las ldog pa yod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar yin /
translated: If it were not so, how could it be said that ‚Äúthe existence of the counter-correlate is the existence of the counter-correlate‚Äù?

original: gal te der ni blo yod na //
analyzed: gal te der ni blo yod na //
translated: If you admit that there is a cognition of non-existence,

original: 'dir yang ci ste 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: 'dir yang ci ste 'dod ma yin //
translated: why not admit it in the case of existence as well?

original: med pa shin tu gsal ba nyid //
analyzed: med pa shin tu gsal ba nyid //
translated: The non-existence of the non-existent is clearly

original: de yi gnas su rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: de yi gnas su rtogs pa yin //
translated: perceived in the place where it is located.

original: gang nam yang de mi srid pa de ni de'i 'byung khungs yin par shin tu yang cher rigs so //üîΩldog pa med pa sgrub pa yin //üîΩdngos po med na'ang yod min la //
analyzed: gang nam yang de mi srid pa de ni de'i 'byung khungs yin par shin tu yang cher rigs so // ldog pa med pa sgrub pa yin // dngos po med na'ang yod min la //
translated: It is quite reasonable to say that the source of something is that from which it originates.

original: dngos po med pa yod min zhes //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yod min zhes //
translated: The non-existence of the non-existent is established by the absence of a counter-correlate.

original: blun po yi ni spyod la ltos //
analyzed: blun po yi ni spyod la ltos //
translated: Look at the behavior of the fool who says thatüîΩnon-existence does not exist and existence does not exist!

original: med pa la dngos po med do zhes ldog pa med pa med pa ni sgrub pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: med pa la dngos po med do zhes ldog pa med pa med pa ni sgrub pa nyid yin pas /
translated: The non-existence of the non-existent is established by the absence of a counter-correlate.

original: dngos po yod pa'i mtshan nyid de ni med pa la yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'i mtshan nyid de ni med pa la yang yod pa yin no //
translated: The characteristic of existence is also present in non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa ni med pa la 'thad pa'i rnag bzhin yang med la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni med pa la 'thad pa'i rnag bzhin yang med la /
translated: The characteristic of non-existence is not tenable in non-existence.

original: bzlog kyang cig shos ni yin no zhes bya ba blun po'i spyod pa las gzhan ci zhig yin /
analyzed: bzlog kyang cig shos ni yin no zhes bya ba blun po'i spyod pa las gzhan ci zhig yin /
translated: But if you reverse it, the other is. What else is this but the behavior of a fool?üîΩThus,üîΩAssertion and denial

original: 'di ltar / sgrub pa dang ni dgag pa dag / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sgrub pa dang ni dgag pa dag / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa na //
translated: are mutually exclusive.

original: rnam gzhan srid pa ma yin phyir //
analyzed: rnam gzhan srid pa ma yin phyir //
translated: Since another possibility is not possible,

original: gnyi ga med ces rigs ma yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga med ces rigs ma yin //
translated: it is not reasonable to say that both do not exist.

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin na gor ma chag par med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin na gor ma chag par med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a thing does not exist, then without a doubt it does not exist.

original: de nyid ni ldog par yang tha snyad byed de /
analyzed: de nyid ni ldog par yang tha snyad byed de /
translated: That very thing is also called ‚Äúreversed.‚Äù

original: de la med pa ni de las mi ldog pa ma yin no /
analyzed: de la med pa ni de las mi ldog pa ma yin no /
translated: But if it does not exist, it is not reversed.

original: med pa nyid kyang de la med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyang de la med pa kho na ste /
translated: Nonexistence itself does not exist in it.

original: gzhi nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it does not have a basis.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: yod pa nyid med pa kho na de la med pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid med pa kho na de la med pa yin no //
translated: Existence itself does not exist in it.

original: de yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang med do zhe na /
translated: But that also does not exist.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni phan tshun med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang dgag par ci ltar @251b 'gyur ;
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni phan tshun med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang dgag par ci ltar @251b 'gyur ;
translated: Because things and nonthings have the nature of mutual exclusion, how could both be negated?

original: dngos po ni gdon mi za bar dngos po med pa rnam par gcad pas de nyid thob pa yin te /üîΩdngos po med na dngos por mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni gdon mi za bar dngos po med pa rnam par gcad pas de nyid thob pa yin te / dngos po med na dngos por mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Things are definitely established by the exclusion of non-things.üîΩBecause if non-things do not exist, things would not exist.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po med par med pa las ldog pa de'i phyir de ldog pa la gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po med par med pa las ldog pa de'i phyir de ldog pa la gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since non-things do not exist without things, therefore, they are definitely excluded.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: gal te dngos po med pa log kyang mi 'gyur na ni med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa log kyang mi 'gyur na ni med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: if non-things were not excluded, they would be nonexistent.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gal te dngos po yod min pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te dngos po yod min pa //
translated: If things do not exist,

original: dngos med nyid du rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos med nyid du rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: non-things would be cognized.

original: ston te dngos med med na ni //
analyzed: ston te dngos med med na ni //
translated: If non-things do not exist,

original: des na dngos po rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: des na dngos po rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: things would be cognized.

original: de yang med na dgag pa 'di //
analyzed: de yang med na dgag pa 'di //
translated: If that also does not exist,

original: mi dmigs pas na med phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pas na med phyir ro //
translated: this negation would not be perceived, because it does not exist.

original: gnyi ga med na dngos po ni //üîΩyod pa bzlog pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: gnyi ga med na dngos po ni // yod pa bzlog pa med pa nyid //
translated: If both do not exist,üîΩthings would not be negated.üîΩIf neither things nor non-things exist,

original: gal te dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga yang med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga yang med pa yin na /
translated: then

original: de lta na yang dngos po'i med pa nyid bzlog tu med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po'i med pa nyid bzlog tu med pa kho na'o //
translated: In that case, the nonexistence of things is certainly not refuted.

original: gal te dngos po yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If things do not exist,

original: de lta na dngos po med par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na dngos po med par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: then they do not become nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du ni dngos po med pa yang med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni dngos po med pa yang med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, nonthings do not become nonexistent.

original: gal te dngos po med pa ma yin la dngos por yang ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa ma yin la dngos por yang ma gyur na /
translated: If nonthings are not nonexistent and do not become things,

original: de nyid dngos po med par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dngos po med par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: then that is the understanding of nonthings.

original: de'i phyir dgag pa 'jug pa nyid des dben par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon sum gyis sgrub pa las phyi rol du rnam par 'jog pa yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag pa 'jug pa nyid des dben par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon sum gyis sgrub pa las phyi rol du rnam par 'jog pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the engagement of a negation itself is posited as external to the proof that has the characteristic of the perception of the absence of that.

original: / de'i phyir tshad ma gcig 'jug pa nyid kyis rnam pa gzhan la rnam pa gzhan gyi ngo bor 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: / de'i phyir tshad ma gcig 'jug pa nyid kyis rnam pa gzhan la rnam pa gzhan gyi ngo bor 'jog pa yin te /
translated: Thus, by the engagement of one valid cognition, another aspect is posited as having a different nature from another aspect,

original: rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: but another aspect does not exist.

original: gang zhig mngon sum der ma chug pa de thams cad ni gzhan kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum der ma chug pa de thams cad ni gzhan kho na'o //
translated: Whatever is not included in that perception is all different from it.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis kyang de la gang zhig de'i rang bzhin du rnam par ma bcad pa de ni de'i rang bzhin du med pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis kyang de la gang zhig de'i rang bzhin du rnam par ma bcad pa de ni de'i rang bzhin du med pa yin te /
translated: Also, a perception apprehending the nature of a thing excludes that which is not its nature.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other mode.

original: dngos po med pa yod pa yongs su gcod pa na yang gang zhig de ltar rnam par ma bcad pa de dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan la srid /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yod pa yongs su gcod pa na yang gang zhig de ltar rnam par ma bcad pa de dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan la srid /
translated: When a non-thing is excluded, that which is not excluded in that way is a thing, because it is possible that it is another mode.

original: gal te rnam gzhan med mod dngos po 'am dngos po med pa de ni med pa la med do zhes gzhi dang bcas pas gcod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rnam gzhan med mod dngos po 'am dngos po med pa de ni med pa la med do zhes gzhi dang bcas pas gcod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If there is no other mode, then that thing or non-thing is not a non-thing, because it is not possible to exclude it with a basis,

original: de nyid bcad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bcad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not excluded.

original: med pa ni gcad par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: med pa ni gcad par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is not possible to exclude a non-thing,

original: de ni ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: that is not so, because it is like this:

original: gal te de la ldog med na //
analyzed: gal te de la ldog med na //
translated: If there is no exclusion of it,

original: gtan tshigs 'jug par 'dod dam ci //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'jug par 'dod dam ci //
translated: is it asserted that the reason is engaged?

original: de yang min na ldog @252a * //
analyzed: de yang min na ldog @252a * //
translated: If it is not that, then there is no exclusion.

original: bkag ni // 'di nyid yin na ci ste 'gog / re zhig khyed la 'di tsam zhig dri ste /
analyzed: bkag ni // 'di nyid yin na ci ste 'gog / re zhig khyed la 'di tsam zhig dri ste /
translated: First, this much should be asked of you:

original: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs med pa de las mi ldog na cig 'jug par 'gyur ram rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs med pa de las mi ldog na cig 'jug par 'gyur ram rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not negated from the absence of a similar instance, then it would be engaged, because there is no other possibility.

original: de ltar na dngos po med pa'i ngag bzhin can gyi ldog par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po med pa'i ngag bzhin can gyi ldog par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Thus, like a statement that lacks an object, the negation would not occur,

original: gal te 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por 'gyur na'o //
translated: if it were an entity that has the nature of engagement.

original: de yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But that is not so, you say.

original: 'o na ldog pa ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ldog pa ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: Well then, the negation is not negated,

original: gang gi phyir khyod kyis bsgrub pa'i ldog pa bkag pa ni 'di nyid yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod kyis bsgrub pa'i ldog pa bkag pa ni 'di nyid yin na /
translated: because this very thing is the negation of the negation that you affirm.

original: de'i phyir ci ste 'gog par byed pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ste 'gog par byed pa /
translated: Therefore, why is it negated?

original: bsgrub pa ni de nyid kyi tshe dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni de nyid kyi tshe dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to negate the affirmation at that time.

original: de'i phyir 'jug pa bkag pa nyid ldog pa yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa bkag pa nyid ldog pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, since the negation of engagement is the negation,

original: de bkag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bkag pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not negated.

original: 'on te de ni 'byung khungs sam gnas nyid du rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir de las ldog pa ma yin par brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni 'byung khungs sam gnas nyid du rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir de las ldog pa ma yin par brjod na /
translated: But if you say that it is not the opposite of that because it is not understood to be the source or the very abode,

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: then here we say:

original: sgrub dang dgag pa ma rtogs par //
analyzed: sgrub dang dgag pa ma rtogs par //
translated: Without understanding affirmation and negation,

original: sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad gzhan //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad gzhan //
translated: there is no other convention that arises from words.

original: yod mi na de yang med pa la //
analyzed: yod mi na de yang med pa la //
translated: And that also does not exist,

original: med phyir 'di ni mi smra thob //
analyzed: med phyir 'di ni mi smra thob //
translated: because it does not exist. Therefore, it is established that this is not spoken.

original: gal te khyed la 'ga' zhig brgal zhing brtag par byed de /
analyzed: gal te khyed la 'ga' zhig brgal zhing brtag par byed de /
translated: If someone were to debate and investigate you,

original: srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: they would say, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it the case that life and so on are not seen in the similar class?

original: des na de las ldog pa las thun mong ma yin pa'i ji ltar go bar byed pa ma yin de lta bu nyid kyang yin na mnyan bya nyid kyang go byed du 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: des na de las ldog pa las thun mong ma yin pa'i ji ltar go bar byed pa ma yin de lta bu nyid kyang yin na mnyan bya nyid kyang go byed du 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Therefore, how could the opposite of that be understood as the uncommon reason? Even if that were so, the object of hearing would also be the reason for understanding.‚Äù

original: des na gdon mi za bar mthun pa'i phyogs med pa ldog pa med do zhes brjod par bya dgos /
analyzed: des na gdon mi za bar mthun pa'i phyogs med pa ldog pa med do zhes brjod par bya dgos /
translated: Therefore, you must say, ‚ÄúWithout a doubt, the absence of the similar class is the absence of the opposite.‚Äù

original: de ltar ma yin na 'dir mi smra ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na 'dir mi smra ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is not so, then here you would obtain silence.

original: ci ste yang de bzhin kho nar 'gyur la drag mod ces bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste yang de bzhin kho nar 'gyur la drag mod ces bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúIt is just so, it is certainly so,‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: rang nyid kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar gcod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar gcod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that you yourself would be killed in some way.

original: tshig ni bzlog par nus kyi /
analyzed: tshig ni bzlog par nus kyi /
translated: Words can be refuted,

original: blo ni ma yin te gdon mi za bar ci zhig ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo ni ma yin te gdon mi za bar ci zhig ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: but the mind cannot, for it would certainly be understood in some way.

original: gzhan yang gal te dngos po med pa nam yang bdag nyid thams cad kyi gnyis nyid dam 'byung ba nyid du rtogs par nus pa ma yin de kho na yin na tha snyad chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te dngos po med pa nam yang bdag nyid thams cad kyi gnyis nyid dam 'byung ba nyid du rtogs par nus pa ma yin de kho na yin na tha snyad chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if a non-thing could never be understood as having a dual nature or as arising in any way, then conventions would be severed.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / yod pa rnams la dgag pa med //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yod pa rnams la dgag pa med //
translated: There is no negation of existent things.

original: de ni med la'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni med la'ang yod ma yin //
translated: Nor is there negation of non-existent things.

original: rigs pa 'di yi 'gro ba la //üîΩdgag pa'i don ni med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di yi 'gro ba la // dgag pa'i don ni med par 'gyur //
translated: By this reasoning,üîΩthe referent of negation would be non-existent.

original: dgag pa'i don ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgag pa'i don ni med pa nyid do //
translated: The referent of negation would be non-existent.

original: des na med pa mi rtogs pa ni ci ltar de sbyor /
analyzed: des na med pa mi rtogs pa ni ci ltar de sbyor /
translated: Therefore, how could a non-thing be applied in any way?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / brjod bya @252b blo la gnas pa yas //
analyzed: 'di ltar / brjod bya @252b blo la gnas pa yas //
translated: The object of expression exists in the mind.

original: de nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to realize thatness,

original: rjod par byed pa'i sbyor 'gyur la //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i sbyor 'gyur la //
translated: one should apply oneself to the expression of it.

original: med pa de gnyis yod ma yin /üîΩ// / bam po bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: med pa de gnyis yod ma yin / // / bam po bcu gsum pa /
translated: The two non-existences do not exist.

original: gal te med pa tsam yul du byed na dgag pa don med pa nyid do //üîΩyul rtogs pa la dgag pa sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te med pa tsam yul du byed na dgag pa don med pa nyid do // yul rtogs pa la dgag pa sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one makes mere non-existence the object, then the negation is pointless.

original: yul rtogs pa la dgag pa sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rtogs pa la dgag pa sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation is applied to the realization of the object.

original: sbyar na yang dgos pa med do //üîΩ'o na gang zhig med pa de yul du bya ba yin na /
analyzed: sbyar na yang dgos pa med do // 'o na gang zhig med pa de yul du bya ba yin na /
translated: Even if it is applied, it is pointless.üîΩWell, if that non-existence is the object,

original: de ltar yin na rtogs bzhin pa nyid med par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar yin na rtogs bzhin pa nyid med par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can that which is being realized be non-existent?

original: 'o na rtogs pa ni rnam pa gzhan du yin la /
analyzed: 'o na rtogs pa ni rnam pa gzhan du yin la /
translated: Well, the realization is in one way,

original: med pa yang rnam pa gzhan du yin no //
analyzed: med pa yang rnam pa gzhan du yin no //
translated: and the non-existence is in another way.

original: 'di ltar yod pa nyid yul la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis dgag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa nyid yul la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis dgag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, some existent that has an object, etc. is to be negated.

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: The response to that is:

original: gal te yul dus 'gog ce na //üîΩci ltar de yod de ltar ni //
analyzed: gal te yul dus 'gog ce na // ci ltar de yod de ltar ni //
translated: If you negate the object and the time,üîΩhow can it exist?

original: mi 'gog ci ltar de med pa //
analyzed: mi 'gog ci ltar de med pa //
translated: In that way it is not negated. How can it not exist?

original: de ltar yang ni 'gog mi 'gyur //üîΩda ltar 'di na rang bzhin 'di ltar med do zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang ni 'gog mi 'gyur // da ltar 'di na rang bzhin 'di ltar med do zhes bya ba yang /
translated: And in that way, it cannot be refuted.

original: dgag par nus pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgag par nus pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: And it is not possible to refute this:üîΩ‚ÄúIn this way, it does not exist in this way.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin gang dang yul gang dang / dus gang yin pa de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin gang dang yul gang dang / dus gang yin pa de /
translated: Because if the nature, the object, and the time exist,

original: gal te yod na ci ltar 'gog /'on te med na blos yul du byed par srid pa ma yin te med pa gcad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na ci ltar 'gog /'on te med na blos yul du byed par srid pa ma yin te med pa gcad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: how can they be refuted? If they do not exist, it is not possible for the mind to take them as objects, because it is not possible to eliminate what does not exist.

original: ci ste yul du byed na de ltar yin na gzhi la sogs pa yang yul du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste yul du byed na de ltar yin na gzhi la sogs pa yang yul du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are taken as objects, then the basis and so on would also be taken as objects.

original: de lta ma yin par yul du bya mi nus pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin par yul du bya mi nus pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is not possible to take as an object what does not exist.

original: / gdon mi za bar byed pa'i ngo bor yongs su gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: / gdon mi za bar byed pa'i ngo bor yongs su gcod pa yin te /
translated: It is certain that the mind takes as its object the nature of the basis.

original: gzhan du srid pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du srid pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible otherwise.

original: gal te yul 'di na med do zhes gzhi'i rang bzhin yul du byas pa yin na med par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te yul 'di na med do zhes gzhi'i rang bzhin yul du byas pa yin na med par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the basis is taken as an object, and the nature of the basis is ‚ÄúIt does not exist in this way,‚Äù how can it be nonexistent?

original: med na ci ltar yul du byed //
analyzed: med na ci ltar yul du byed //
translated: If it does not exist, how can it be taken as an object?

original: 'on te dgag par bya ba sgro btags nas 'gog par byed na /
analyzed: 'on te dgag par bya ba sgro btags nas 'gog par byed na /
translated: But if you refute by superimposing a negatee,

original: de ltar yin na mthun pa'i phyogs kyang sgror btags nas mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yod pa yin ba'i phyir ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs las mi ldog //
analyzed: de ltar yin na mthun pa'i phyogs kyang sgror btags nas mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yod pa yin ba'i phyir ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs las mi ldog //
translated: then since the similar instance also exists as the opposite of the similar instance, how could it not be the opposite of the similar instance?

original: des na phyi rol la don brtan pa'i brtan pa'i bsgrub pa dang dgag pa ni tha snyad mi srid pa de'i srid pa de'i phyir tha snyad chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na phyi rol la don brtan pa'i brtan pa'i bsgrub pa dang dgag pa ni tha snyad mi srid pa de'i srid pa de'i phyir tha snyad chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible to affirm or deny an external object, the conventional would be annihilated.

original: gal te sgrub pa'i tha snyad srid ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa'i tha snyad srid ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the conventional affirmation possible?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: yul du bya ba la sgrub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul du bya ba la sgrub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no affirmation in the object.

original: bum pa yod ces bya ba gal te yod par bzung na de nyid sgrub pa yin pas yang yod do zhes sgrub bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: bum pa yod ces bya ba gal te yod par bzung na de nyid sgrub pa yin pas yang yod do zhes sgrub bas ci zhig bya /
translated: If ‚Äúthe pot exists‚Äù is taken to mean that it exists, then since that is itself the affirmation, what is the use of affirming ‚Äúit exists‚Äù again?

original: 'on te med par yin na des na 'gal ba'i phyir med pa ni yod do zhes sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'on te med par yin na des na 'gal ba'i phyir med pa ni yod do zhes sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: But if it is taken to mean that it does not exist, then since that is contradictory, it is impossible to affirm ‚Äúit exists‚Äù as ‚Äúit does not exist.‚Äù

original: gal te yod @253a * //üîΩpar bcad na ni //
analyzed: gal te yod @253a * //üîΩpar bcad na ni //
translated: If it is taken to mean that it exists,üîΩthen since it is already established, what is the use of affirming it again?

original: de la sgrub pa don med yin //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa don med yin //
translated: Then the proof would be pointless.

original: med par yongs su bcad phyir na //
analyzed: med par yongs su bcad phyir na //
translated: Because of the exclusion of nonexistence,

original: sgrub pa gzhan du nus ma yin //
analyzed: sgrub pa gzhan du nus ma yin //
translated: The proof cannot be otherwise.

original: de phyir dngos dngos med rten pa //
analyzed: de phyir dngos dngos med rten pa //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the words ‚Äúexistence‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistence‚Äù

original: phyi rol rten min sgra don la //
analyzed: phyi rol rten min sgra don la //
translated: Is not the same as the meaning of the words ‚Äúexternal‚Äù and ‚Äúinternal.‚ÄùüîΩHere, we accept all proofs and refutations

original: brten nas 'dir ni sgrub pa dang // dgag pa thams cad 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: brten nas 'dir ni sgrub pa dang // dgag pa thams cad 'dod pa yin //
translated: In dependence on the meanings of the words.

original: tshad ma'i don yang gzhan yin la //
analyzed: tshad ma'i don yang gzhan yin la //
translated: The meaning of valid cognition is one thing,

original: sgra yi don yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: sgra yi don yang gzhan yin no //
translated: And the meaning of the words is another.

original: sgra'i don ni yod pa dang dngos po med pa'i rten yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra'i don ni yod pa dang dngos po med pa'i rten yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of the words is the basis of existence and nonexistence,

original: tshad ma'i don ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i don ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But the meaning of valid cognition is not like that.

original: tshad ma'i don ni dngos po med pa'i rten ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i don ni dngos po med pa'i rten ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of valid cognition is not the basis of nonexistence.

original: tshad ma'i don ni rnam pa gzhan du srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i don ni rnam pa gzhan du srid pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of valid cognition is not possible in any other way,

original: rang bzhin nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rang bzhin nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because its nature is ascertained.

original: / sgra las zhig la blo ci 'dra //
analyzed: / sgra las zhig la blo ci 'dra //
translated: What is the nature of the cognitionüîΩThat arises from the words ‚Äúexistent‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù?

original: ma zhig pa la'ang de 'dra nyid //
analyzed: ma zhig pa la'ang de 'dra nyid //
translated: It is the same as the cognition that arises from the words ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù and ‚Äúnot existent.‚Äù

original: des na dngos dngos med rten ni //
analyzed: des na dngos dngos med rten ni //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the words ‚Äúexistence‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistence‚Äù

original: sgra don tshad ma'i de lta min //
analyzed: sgra don tshad ma'i de lta min //
translated: Is not the same as the meaning of valid cognition.

original: des na sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gi yul ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: des na sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gi yul ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos brtags pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the object of affirmation and negation is the conceptualized object of the conceptual mind.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams ni dngos po la 'jug par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams ni dngos po la 'jug par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conceptualizations are not ascertained to engage real things.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa yang thams cad ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa yang thams cad ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: And the nonconceptual is not a valid cognition in all cases.

original: gal te tshad ma ma yin pa sgrub pa'i tshul du zhugs na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma ma yin pa sgrub pa'i tshul du zhugs na /
translated: If it engages in the manner of affirming a nonvalid cognition,

original: des na de tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dgag par byed la /
analyzed: des na de tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dgag par byed la /
translated: then it is negated in order to teach that it is not a valid cognition.

original: dgag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs na ni sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: dgag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs na ni sgrub par byed do //
translated: If it engages in the manner of negation, then it is affirmed.

original: gal te 'di rtogs pa 'khrul pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe bdag nyid de lta bu nyid du gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'di rtogs pa 'khrul pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe bdag nyid de lta bu nyid du gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If this realization is mistaken, then it is clear that it is just like that.

original: rang rig pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no error in reflexive awareness.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni gzhan du mthong bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni gzhan du mthong bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: One‚Äôs own nature cannot be seen as other.

original: rang gi ngo bo las nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would lose its own nature.

original: rnam pa gzhan du snang na de nyid kyang rang gi ngo bo yin pas der yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du snang na de nyid kyang rang gi ngo bo yin pas der yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it appears in another aspect, that itself is its own nature, and so it would be like that, and so there would be an infinite regress.

original: rang gi ngo bor yod na ni dngos po'i nye bar len pa can nyid 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor yod na ni dngos po'i nye bar len pa can nyid 'gog pa yin no //
translated: If it existed as its own nature, it would be the appropriator of the thing.

original: chos can de yang rang gi ngo bos rtogs pas na gang gis de gnyis dang 'brel par 'gyur ba ci ltar sgrub pa dang dgag pa thun mong pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chos can de yang rang gi ngo bos rtogs pas na gang gis de gnyis dang 'brel par 'gyur ba ci ltar sgrub pa dang dgag pa thun mong pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the subject is understood by its own nature, then how could it be established as common to both affirmation and negation, which are related to it?

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de 'dra med na'ang chos can de //
analyzed: de 'dra med na'ang chos can de //
translated: Even though it does not exist in that way, the subject

original: de dag dang ni 'brel par snang //
analyzed: de dag dang ni 'brel par snang //
translated: appears to be related to them.

original: de yang sgra 'jug pa nyid las //
analyzed: de yang sgra 'jug pa nyid las //
translated: And that is also asserted to be the basis of the convention

original: yod ces tha snyad rten par 'dod //
analyzed: yod ces tha snyad rten par 'dod //
translated: ‚Äúexists,‚Äù due to the engagement of the term.

original: tha snyad 'di phyi rol dang nang gi rang bzhin nyid la brten pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tha snyad 'di phyi rol dang nang gi rang bzhin nyid la brten pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This convention is not based on external or internal natures,

original: 'on kyang sgra'i don la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra'i don la brten pa yin no //
translated: but rather on the meaning of the term.

original: sgras ni phyi dang nang gi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgras ni phyi dang nang gi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The term does not understand the external or internal nature.

original: gal te de las ma rtogs pa @253b gzhan med pa'i phyir sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag tha snyad ji ltar rten zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de las ma rtogs pa @253b gzhan med pa'i phyir sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag tha snyad ji ltar rten zhe na /
translated: If there is nothing other than that which is not understood, how can affirmation and negation be based on the conventional?

original: gzhan sel ba la brten no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba la brten no zhes brjod do //
translated: They are based on the exclusion of other.üîΩWhat is this that is said to be based on the exclusion of other?

original: gzhan sel ba la brten no zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / sgra la rtogs pa gang yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba la brten no zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / sgra la rtogs pa gang yin na'o //
translated: It is the understanding that occurs in regard to a word.

original: rtogs pa de gang yin zhes bya ba de nyid de ltar brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtogs pa de gang yin zhes bya ba de nyid de ltar brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it just that which is called ‚Äúthe understanding‚Äù?

original: cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: Not at all.

original: de lta na yang tha snyad 'di ni thog ma med pa'i kun du rmongs pa bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang tha snyad 'di ni thog ma med pa'i kun du rmongs pa bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, this conventional usage is produced by beginningless ignorance.

original: 'di ltar rnam par dpyad na phyi rol la lam nang 'dra ba yod pa ma yin na'ang sgra'i don gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos can de sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag dang 'brel pa lta bur mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par dpyad na phyi rol la lam nang 'dra ba yod pa ma yin na'ang sgra'i don gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos can de sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag dang 'brel pa lta bur mngon pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although no external object exists as it is imagined to exist, the object of a word, which is a property possessor defined by the characteristics of the object of a word, appears to be related to the affirmation or negation of a property.

original: de skad du yang 'di la dngos po cung zad med ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad du yang 'di la dngos po cung zad med ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúthere is no real entity here at all.‚Äù

original: gal te de la phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du sgro btags pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de la phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du sgro btags pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the nature of the external object is superimposed on consciousness?

original: ma yin te shes pa dang shes bya ma rtogs pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te shes pa dang shes bya ma rtogs pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is impossible for there to be any other consciousness or object of consciousness that is not realized.

original: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yod do zhe na /
translated: But the nature of error exists!

original: de yang gal te rang gi ngo bos rtogs na ci ltar 'khrul /
analyzed: de yang gal te rang gi ngo bos rtogs na ci ltar 'khrul /
translated: If it is realized by its own nature, how can it be error?

original: 'on te ma rtogs na ci ltar yul yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma rtogs na ci ltar yul yin /
translated: But if it is not realized, how can it be an object?

original: ma rtogs par ni yod do zhes lhag par nges nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs par ni yod do zhes lhag par nges nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to ascertain that it exists without being realized.

original: phyis 'khrul par shes so zhe na /
analyzed: phyis 'khrul par shes so zhe na /
translated: But later it is known to be error!

original: 'o na dang por rang gi ngo bor ma rtogs pas ji ltar yod do zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa'i yul yin /
analyzed: 'o na dang por rang gi ngo bor ma rtogs pas ji ltar yod do zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa'i yul yin /
translated: Well then, since it is not realized as its own nature in the beginning, how can it be an object that is posited as existing?

original: gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bos rtogs na ni rtogs pa gzhan 'khrul gyi de nyid ni ma yin pas na thug pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bos rtogs na ni rtogs pa gzhan 'khrul gyi de nyid ni ma yin pas na thug pa med do //
translated: If it is realized by the nature of another, then the other realization is error, but not that itself, so there is an infinite regress.

original: 'on te de mi bden pa nyid du nges pas na 'khrul par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de mi bden pa nyid du nges pas na 'khrul par brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that it is called error because it is ascertained to be false,

original: de ni mi bden pa gang yin /
analyzed: de ni mi bden pa gang yin /
translated: What is it that is not real?

original: don la ma reg pa nyid do //
analyzed: don la ma reg pa nyid do //
translated: It is the non-contact with the object.

original: de nyid de'i rang bzhin ma yin nam ci ltar mi bden pa nyid yin rang gi rang bzhin la gnas pa nyid ni mi bden par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de'i rang bzhin ma yin nam ci ltar mi bden pa nyid yin rang gi rang bzhin la gnas pa nyid ni mi bden par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Isn‚Äôt that just its nature? How can it be unreal? It is not that what abides in its own nature becomes unreal.

original: rnam pa gzhan du nges pa bskyed pa'i phyir mi bden pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du nges pa bskyed pa'i phyir mi bden pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is unreal because it generates a different aspect,

original: 'o na nges pa nyid pa mi bden par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na nges pa nyid pa mi bden par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the very ascertainment would be unreal.

original: des de bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des de bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it generates that.

original: de yang mi bden pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de yang mi bden pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that is also just unreal,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: no, it is not.

original: bag chags kyi nges par rnam pa gzhan du bskyed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bag chags kyi nges par rnam pa gzhan du bskyed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the ascertainment of the latent potentialities generates a different aspect.

original: / de lta yin na nges par 'khrul pa nyid do zhes bya ba yang ma 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: / de lta yin na nges par 'khrul pa nyid do zhes bya ba yang ma 'brel pa yin te /
translated: If that were so, it would be just a mistake to generate ascertainment, and that is not related.

original: de yang rang gi rang bzhin la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rang gi rang bzhin la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that also abides in its own nature.

original: de'i phyir sgra'i don ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i don ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
